RbbsTsdJa0XiDDcWHdmwpg.text: A strong 3 Stars IMHO...  I saw a tip recently that they do a great California Roll here...lol...well they do more than that.  There are only a few incredible things I find here these days (under the "new" owner and staff,) but there is still a lot they are doing right here.  As I see it, there are two reasons to come here: Uni & AYCE.  They don't serve any disappointments here.  Just about everything is a little above average, so with AYCE you get a lot of good food at a solid price $26/$27 I think. OzDViPT6jUGFo4BFeAuYSQ.text: New listing?  New owner?  Not sure why it's "new," but in the end, it doesn't really matter.  I put my trust in you....wait, got sidetracked for a second....  How's the food???  THAT'S what matters to me!!  Well, as you might have guessed seeing the 5 star review, it's better than good in my book.  It was surprisingly good actually!  I ordered about 15 different kinds of Nigiri.  Not ONE of them were disappointing!  All tasted fresh, but here are some noteworthy ones to touch on :  Uni : Very good Uni! Love the consistency...not watery/runny or overly salty!  I am SUPER particular when it comes to uni...it's the difference between thoroughly enjoying it, or slightly gagging on it at first taste.  Thankfully, it's the former.  Hotate : The Fresh Scallops were PERFECT! Super tender, melt in your mouth good! Buttery, with just a hint of citrus and wasabi of course...only thing I have found to rival it ANYWHERE is YG&S's LIVE counterpart!  And considering that it's not FAIR to compare it, this is the best I've found LOL :P  Amaebi : The sweet shrimp had a slight crunch to it, buttery taste, and smooth finish.  Great choice.  I did not receive the fried heads...you probably need to specify if you want them.  The Hamachi Kama was on the daily special...this is my most favorite part of the fish!  If you see it on the menu and don't mind diggin in for the good stuff, you gotta try the collar if you have been sleeping under a rock!  If you've had it before, you are gonna order it without reading this anyways LOL.  And for dessert, both the Chocolate Mousse and Green Tea Creme Brulee were on daily special.  If you see either on the menu, I would highly recommend both!  Chocolate mousse is a little thicker than their sister stores counterpart, but still that same great taste.  The creme brulee was perfect...strong green tea taste, and I love that crispy crust!  Service was very fast.  They were pretty slow on this Tuesday night, which got me worried about the quality I was to encounter, but I am glad it didn't affect my visit.  But because it was slow, my orders got taken promptly, food was prepared and served quickly, and I always had refills etc.  Only NEGATIVE thing I can think of...I got charged $3 for "sharing" with Little Foodie Dude.  He just turned two, and yes, he DOES have an appetite LOL, but it will mark forever in history as his first charge at an AYCE restaurant.  I'm not too mad though, considering he ate an entire order of Edamame, 4 pieces of unagi, ahi, salmon skin handroll etc lol.  He got his $3 worth :P  I hope it wasn't a fluke, but I much preferred my visit today than the last few times I have been to the Henderson location, as well as the G'monster himself!  All they need now is the Grilled Pork Belly and I'll never have to go back there again lol.  Keep it up Sushi-Mon...keep the ball rollin forward and never look back!  Pics :

ol9jBBfLbSLKSv6GCNnKNQ.text: My best friend and I have been coming here for years, back when Linda owned this place ( 10 years!). The staff and ownership have changed, but the service has remained friendly and polite, and the menu has remained excellent. My ONLY complaint is the switch from having fountain soda to cans. Frankly, it feels lazy and beneath Sushi Mon. As for recommendations, I always order a bunch of Cajun albacore, and the a chi chi (sp?) roll with the sauces on the side. I love spicy food, but my friend does not, so we can eat this roll to our liking! Recently, a waitress offered us the chance to try their fresh wasabi (Wow! What a difference! Definitely try it! So fresh and spicy!) I really hope the new owners switch back to fountain soda, but overall, this place is excellent!

QIUn3WdEmImE87mDIIWAuA.text: My friends and I come here for a day trip from Cali to Vegas from time to time. If that doesn't say good food (for the price) then what does?

UxJqfh8i2R54Wh10QPyvgA.text: You can't go wrong with All You Can Eat at Sushi Mon!  You get 45 minutes of pure indulgence for $21.95 at lunch time.  The sushi rolls are large and taste so good.  Not only do you get sushi rolls you also get hot food options like teriyaki chicken to shrimp tempura to steamed or fried gyoza.  There are cold salad options too.  The main "rule" here is that if you order it you better finish it as you will be charged additional for unfinished rolls.  They have a great half roll option so there should be no issues finishing what you order.    The service is great and you don't wait long once you start ordering.  We placed our order and within 5 minutes our awesome sushi started rolling out.  The waitress was pleasant and didn't look at us like we were big ol pigs for ordering so much.  The gyoza was fresh with a great filling that included cabbage.  The teriyaki chicken wasn't the best, it's all up to how you like it prepared.  The sushi was on point and there were a ton of sushi rolls to choose from.  The JJ roll and the 007 roll were great and try the royal California roll too.  The supreme Alaska was full of tasty salmon.  Ohhhhh the spicy tuna is the perfect amount of spicy and the Cajun albacore nigiri is great!  Damn me!  I'm hungry for sushi again!!!   Parking was easy and there is quite a bit of it.  This restaurant is just below Durango on Sahara.  It's in between Cimmaron and  Durango on the north side of the road.  It's in the same parking lot and just a few stores away from Nothing Bundt Cakes.  Paymons is in the same parking lot too.  We walked out beyond full ready to pop from this awesome meal!

Yf8jKTmlZDttmr7ONoARjA.text: The best Sushi in town we always go there for all you can eat Sushi Lunch $21 Dinner $29/person. Try fried Shrimp head and Calamari.

IuwZLbpnqUHG8BMWl3oNBA.text: I came here for lunch with a friend, we ordered all you can eat sushi, and requested lite rice.  Hamachi was great. Sexy girl was good. Dragon roll,  the eel was like a leather shoe. (I'm not a dog, leather shoes aren't my thing) Rainbow roll, the fish was disgusting.   I asked the server to take the eel roll back prior to receiving the rainbow roll. I explained the eel being a little off, she gladly returned the dragon roll.  Once we received the rainbow roll, (I could see the color was not what I though it could be.) my friend had a bite and didn't say much, I had a bite and the fish was awful. I looked at my friend and he is slowly spitting his bite into a napkin.  We asked the server if she could take it back and asked for our bill.  The server then brought the manager to our table and the manager advised me, "if I eat one more piece, she won't charge me for the roll"  I declined her offer and we asked for the bill again.  The bill came and she charged us for our all you can eat, and an additional charge for the rainbow roll.   All together, the woman handled the situation poorly.  I didn't eat the roll because it would make me sick, this is poor quality fish.  The fact that this was a "manager" asked me to eat another piece of this god awful fish is asinine.   We received our check with 2 all you can eat (which is expected and we are fine with) and additional charge for that rotting roll of fish.   Save your appetite unless you want to scream out of your anus.

Here's why I'll be returning to Sushi Mon in Summerlin:  - Prices are low but the quality of sushi didn't suffer, in fact it was quite good  - You can order half rolls with most of their specialty rolls, allowing you to try more without filling up too quickly  - When filling up quickly isn't a concern, they offer all you can eat, almost all day, for the price of about 2.5 specialty rolls  - Their lychee ice cream was some of the best I've ever had and a wonderful finish to the meal

QJzFUCvCt6511iw0xE4OEQ.text: Hubby took me here yesterday night for both of our first times. It's a smaller place, not as big as most sushi places in town. Although it looked as a full house, we were seated within 5-10 minutes. Immediately we were greeted with our server who asked us for our drinks and took a look at the menus.  We both had AYCE sushi, so this is what we ordered. 2x Garlic Tuna Nigiri Fried Gyoza Fried Calamari Shrimp Tempura Roll  Teriyaki Chicken Orion Roll (8pcs) 1/2 Order Crispy Rice (5 pcs) Steamed Shumai 2x Shrimp Tempura Cajun Albacore Nigiri 1/2 Order Cynthia Roll (5 pcs) 1/2 Order Royal California Roll (5 pcs)  Everything was so good, the service was prompt and all the food came out in good time. Would definitely recommend this place for the sushi lover who doesn't like the craziness of other AYCE sushi places. More secluded, more intimate. Definitely worth it!

6LSrG6wP1mqzgQ6ddnNP7w.text: I ate here a lot until a recent experience.  There seems to be a shift in the quality and service from the past. There were new slow inexperienced servers now unlike before. I usually get AYCE and never had any issues.  Now they are like sushi nazi's. Watching the clock to make sure you don't order anything even a minute past your allowed time, trying to charge me for one piece of uneaten sushi from a roll I didn't really care for, I felt the eyes looking at us making sure my girlfriend who didn't get AYCE didn't have any of my order, etc.  they also seemed to disappear after my first round of ordering trying to allow the clock to run down, and limit the amount of sushi I could order in the time frame.  All in all it seems like they are out to save as much money, and pinch all the  pennies as possible (scary with a sushi restaurant). I also had a frequent AYCE card that was filled up and ready to use for a free meal. I had no idea, but it had expired the day before. They refused to accept it!    I won't be going there anymore, and they lost a loyal customer.  They saved a penny, but only to loose a dollar.

Fhiik-T74n7I6pIp8RSPDg.text: For 5 years, Sushi Mon and sister restaurant Goyemon have been our go-to establishments for AYCE sushi, but unfortunately the quality continues to decline at both locations. About 1.5 yrs ago, they changed the unagi to a lesser quality and smaller portion. It's been downhill since then. At Sushi Mon recently, we had to send back the snow crab because it was starting to spoil and was inedible. They are serving salmon nigiri that includes sinews from the worst parts of the fish. Gone is the beautiful marbling of fat that should be seen with good quality salmon nigiri. The California role? Though this role blasphemes the very idea of traditional sushi, the one they served us should be a source of major embarrassment to any sushi chef. The uni thankfully was fresh and delicious. I know the quality of AYCE sushi can never match a la carte, but in this case, the AYCE sushi used to be much better. The price hasn't gone down, but now the quality has dipped so far that we've decided to start searching for a new favorite sushi spot, sorry to say.

5xrgfRYbUEgEFvt1XLOlVg.text: Waited a million years to be seated. Food comes out slow thanks to slow service and wanting to save money on all you can eat sushi.

mXQNZhZbdVVp1HHGqzfT0A.text: Get the sexy girl. and the dinner combos are great for 2 people.  Would recommend to friends and family.  Service is good and the sushi is fresh.  Enjoyed meals there every time they are consistent with their excellent food.

o-ZN6ahyYCMzFt-gl1rbzQ.text: I come here quite often because the location is very close to me. It just so happens that they serve very good quality sushi! It has been a few months since I have last visited, but today it seemed like it was exceptionally flavorful. The staff is also fantastic. They're all super sweet and attentive.  The rolls are always delicious, and well made, especially when they're AYCE which at many places tends to be sloppy. My favorites are their takoyaki, baked green mussels, garlic tuna, super white tuna, red snapper, the Moon Roll, and the Ecstasy Roll. A couple of small things I wish they could improve on are outside seating and a tiny bit more effort on sweeping. With the outside seating, it gets pretty busy some nights, and you can not sit unless your entire party is present. With the sweeping, the restaurant is pretty much always clean, but my boyfriend dropped a piece from his roll today and there was rice everywhere under his seat. We got the attention of one the staff and told them what happened, and if I was a host or server there, my first instinct would be to sweep it up right away.

GjhuGW5SgnxbX_M07njIcg.text: Sushi Mon has two locations in Vegas. This one here in Sahara, and another in Maryland Pkwy (South Vegas). The South Vegas location is the original. Both locations are one of the best AYCE Sushi joints in Vegas. Lunch AYCE is $21.95 and dinner is $26.95. You don't have to get AYCE and can just order like a normal restaurant. But I think the prices for the All you can eat is quite a good deal if you know what to order. The quality of fish is fresh and I never had a Nigiri or roll I didn't like.  Here's the Nigiri you can order in AYCE (not including the special rolls and appetizers you can also get. Each order is 2 pieces of Nigiri.) My favorites being: 1. Salmon ( A very fresh and clean tasting fish. I highly recommend this to first time sushi eaters as it doesn't have any fishy smell and is very smooth. My all time favorite.) 2. Yellowtail ( Classified as a "Luxury fish" Has a rich oily texture. The flesh is light red, A good piece of Yellowtail has very rich flavors. I used to go deep sea fishing for this with my late father. )  3. Halibut ( White meat of the sea, Hirame has a very light taste and is delicate. The meat has a soft and chewy texture and lots of flavor. Another fish I used to go deep sea fishing for. Quite an ugly fish if you ever catch one yourself. But one of my favorites by far. 4. Unagi (Grilled Fresh water Eel. Has a rich flavor and should be both crisp and tender. I recommend this fish at the end of the meal as the flavor is strong and may overwhelm your taste buds. You want to start off with the lighter tasting fish to fully enjoy the taste of Sushi.)  Tuna (Maguro)   $3.85 Garlic Tuna   $4.20 Seared Tuna   $4.20 Super White Tuna   $4.50 Yellowtail (Hamachi)   $3.90 Salmon (Sake)   $3.85 Seared Salmon   $4.20 Albacore (Bincho)   $4.20 Cajun Albacore   $4.50 Halibut (Hirame)   $4.00 Red Snapper (Tai)   $3.80 Mackerel (Saba)   $3.80 Fresh Scallop (hotate)   $4.75 Yum Yum Scallop   $3.50 Shrimp (Ebi)   $4.00 Squid (Ika)   $3.75 Octopus (Tako)   $3.80 Surf Clam (Hokki)   $3.80 Crab Stick   $3.50 Crab Meat   $3.50 Snow Crab Meat   $4.95 Fresh Water Eel (Unagi)   $4.50 Smelt Egg (Masago)   $3.50 Salmon Roe (Ikura)   $4.20 Sweet Egg (Tamago)   $3.00 Sweet Shrimp (Amaebi)   $5.50 Sea Urchin (Uni)   $7.00

Ft59QktdwAvd_bMXjwwPSA.text: Do not eat here! I took a couple of friends to sushi mon over the weekend and their service was horrible.  Moreover, they served our table spoiled uni. When I complained to the waitress and cashier they both acted as if nothing was wrong. Fyi, when you complain coincidentally no one speaks English.

gMukiM7vV8w4UHfA1kMufw.text: AWESOME FOOD!! Fresh Blue Fin tonight was amazing. Never had a bad experience here. RICHARD IS THE GREATEST!  Great chef who always makes the experience even better!!!

4tBvbfyEog8MpQ4L6Xwv3Q.text: I come here all the time. It's my go to place, very affordable and very clean. The bathrooms are awesome as well. Food there is Grade A and some of the best sushi I've ever had. The chefs there are so nice and friendly, there's an older Japanese man who is just the cutest! And he always makes my rolls perfect. 10/10 always. The staff is also very friendly and helpful with every question I have.

Fk4QF7gtSqUwnyaDioHdTg.text: Our go-to-place in Vegas when we want comfort food. Food and service is great.  The place is open late for that late night fix.

mflEJ5BYSlMEb17WJtI5ZQ.text: By far, my favorite sushi restaurant here in Las Vegas!  How they manage to serve quality tasting fish in the middle of the desert is beyond me!  I normally tackle the all-you-can-eat menu, which allows me to try everything in small portions (great when trying new items, or just enough before you call it quits!). The nigiri is great, as well as their house specialty rolls, which I suggest ordering later so you don't cork up your appetite so soon. Don't forget to save room for dessert(s) which is also included in AYCE- the tempura ice cream and lychee sorbet are my favorites!  For smaller appetites, the "screaming orgasm," curry and udon are delicious "regular menu" options.  The staff is always friendly and attentive. The atmosphere is casual and fun. Being such a popular restaurant, you and your party may not be seated right away, but it's definitely worth the wait!

3E59t4HolR5l71beQDfQBw.text: My wife and I eat at this location at least once a month.  Today was our anniversary so we decided to go here.  This visit was awful.  Normally the service is excellent, but tonight not even close.  After our 1st serving of the all you can eat deal the waiter asked if we were ready for desert, and ask three more times before we were finished.  We were reminded that our hour was up and we could make one final order.  I have no problem with this, but it was the first time that has happened.  While I was still chewing my food the waiter who had dropped our check on our table kept checking to see if we put our card out to pay, and we said we would pay at the counter and he said they needed the table.  So before I swallowed we just got up and paid.  I am terribly disappointed and most likely will not go back.  It's sad because the food is great and I can deal with bad service, but not straight up rudeness.

q_RM8kStO-A1Pib7ocaFVA.text: I love this place for lunch when I'm in a bit of a hurry. I've tried other places around town and always come back here. The sashimi lunch is so fresh and delicious and reasonably priced.

H_xhWfViuzeaB8wxvQbYfA.text: What a shame? New ownership. Used to come once a week. Was very friendly relaxed atmosphere. Maybe it's changed in the last 4-5 months, but after the changeover it became very uncomfortable. Large slices of fish became thin. Included items became additional charges. I have a son, 2 years old. As a regular, I think you let people get away with things (I say this as a restaurant owner who let's my regular customers have things all the time). I have to admit, I was annoyed when they charged my son who eats two pieces of a roll and plays with a third piece. I'm not cheap and I don't mind paying for him, but we were good for at least once a week. . . Let it slide.   Then flavors from the kitchen changed too. Take it or leave it. I bought my restaurant as an existing business as well. Your customers liked what they received. You may think you're improving something, but in reality you are changing something that people like. It was good before. Now we're regulars at sushi koma. Very happy, but miss the old crew.

SzQLQIBcr-9BkUbfnLTBkw.text: Lots of good reviews on here so I went. Also kudos from co-workers. I am on the fence. Not very fresh, fish was warm and so was some of the rice. Sushi rollers ( would not call them chefs) not that friendly. Wait staff was okay. Tasted something funky in the Alaskan roll. Good thing they give you half rolls! I don't think I would try this one again.

r_FzDlvKmHKh-73357FqPw.text: AYCE. 60 minutes to chow down. The 911 roll is ridiculously spicy. It warns you on the menu, but oh man. My entire mouth was on fire. I also had the orion roll. Very tasty. The staff was slow to come back and get our order, but as our stay continued the service picked up. My husband wasn't impressed with his tuna roll. He felt like it had been made and was sitting out.  However he loved his spam roll and his deep fried California roll. All in all a pretty successful dinner.

3v7zeNRLUyR-rnT1qJRvOQ.text: The fish wasn't very fresh. It was borderline going bad. I was extremely disappointed. I used to go all the time when I lived on that side of town and it was amazing years ago but I don't think I'll be returning. I've had better sushi from a grocery store.

nBrVvMfok4p8juYNLZmfBA.text: Great food great service favorite sushi restaurant! Went here with my wife and had a great experience drinks and plates were always Instantly refilled the sushi chef himself was very nice and would talk and laugh with us. Just a great time altogether

kIcQtrMfL9SWZsiFDNsd4A.text: My friend's daughter became sick from the fish there.  When they tried to reach out to sushi mon about it, they ignored their calls and communication attempts.  Stay away from this place.

-jEBs2GJxzl-LmgxHvOzoQ.text: Love this place!  We probably go here 1-2 times per month.  We have been to nearly every ayce sushi restaurant in town and this is a definite favorite.  They have great fish and portions, particularly for ayce. The fish is always fresh and served in generous portions in relation to rice.  Chef Mike is the best and makes a killer Tekka Maki. The volcano roll and steamed gyoza are also excellent.  I highly recommend!

ffc6IKRckiFzJ3qyh9cOKg.text: I love this place. The Plum wine is great, the service is awesome. It is a great price point. I can't complain about one thing. I always get the chicken teriyaki bowl, its soo good. Everyone who visits me here, from out of town. I take them there and they love it. We go to the one by South Maryland Parkway.

D2e6oXEVPLfwZsHNPcR96w.text: Used to come here a few years ago as my go to spot, but the last few times were disappointing. It actually used to be pretty good. Something about their rice makes it too soggy and it falls apart. Had some vegetable tempura that didn't even seem fried all the way and was drenched in grease. I probably won't be coming back to be honest.

GkzpnghfNr1JzZkZgulAPQ.text: It was my birthday and I wanted Sushi. I had come here once years ago and didnt really remember the experiance but I figured if I didnt remember anything bad, then I must have enjoyed myself. I was not disappointed. Let me say that every selecion I made was delicious. The staff answered any question my wife or I had. The food came quick and the staff was attentive to our needs. Now for the best part. Due to the fact that it was my birthday (I let the waitress know) when my icecream dessert was served, it had a candle on it and a chorus of happy birthday began. If that wasnt enough as we were about to leave my waitress asked what size I wore, and she presented me with a shirt for my birthday! What a way to finish the evening. I shall return.

swjqfl9elXPdLvnF2rZjUQ.text: My husband and I have been coming here for years.. Really loved this place for all you can eat sushi. It only takes one bad experience to run off good customers!! They have a sign as soon as you walk in that if all your party is not present, that seat will be given to next customers.. So was not the case today.. As they left 2 open seats empty for 15 minutes to wait for another person to join a party at sushi bar as other people were waiting for seats. When I asked employee for a manager, she paused for a few seconds and said that they were not available!! One star because I really liked the variety; but we ended finding something better and less expensive without all the "rules" and "time limit"!!

JWBTwM4hN2RKrF28ddey5w.text: After the owner sold this place, it really lost a lot of its quality. The new interior is confusing... And the sushi chefs are a bunch of ransoms. They have a new "we can't seat you until your whole party is seated" rule, and wouldn't let us sit because my mom was still getting the baby out of the car. The food was okay and the rolls are all the same and a small selection. My tuna poki still had fish scales on it. The eel was dry, and the uni was spoiled. The only good roll was the spider roll. When I tried to pick up my baked mussel I ordered, IT BURNED MY INDEX FINGER AND ITS NOW BLISTERED. I will not be back.

IWC2ZTYBQCmMICZwdecj8g.text: Pretty average sushi spot. Spider roll very good though, nicely crisped soft shell crab. Service very pleasant and generally quick. Too many other good places for sushi to prompt a return visit.

K_lP2sajYLflvz349v9ayQ.text: I went there to treat a good friend of mine to an all you can eat sushi.  I have always been pleased of the service there in the past.  Tonight, it was by far the worse customer service I have ever had in an AYCE sushi.  The waitress on more than one occasion kept telling us to eat our food and finish it!  She was hesitant to take our order and looked at our food every time we ordered and reminded us AGAIN to eat all that we ordered!!!  Obviously, I told her that I have been there before and know their rules!

e73AHwjz0IwxbClAu--1jQ.text: Salmon Belly and Blue Fin Tuna Nigiri..... yes please!  50 pieces? Wow!

Q-cDQmDRCzYFgtncIuTkzw.text: Looks like they have a new manager at this location.  We tried to eat dinner here tonight with the family.  It was half full at 7pm and we tried to get a table for 5.  She said it would be 30 minutes.  There were a few empty tables that they could've pushed together.  There was a huge open area in the sushi bar that could've easily accommodated our group.    I brought this up to the lady...this new manager.  She said that it is their policy NOT to move chairs or tables.   LOL.  Seriously?!!  I asked why is this a policy?!?  She had no explanation but said it was their restaurant policy.    The sushi chefs...most who we know...just watched and shook their heads.  Probably because we tip the sushi chefs $20 on each visit.   THANK GOD FOR THIS INCOMPETENT MANAGER.  We left and went to the new Sushi Loca in Downtown Summerlin.  Service, Food, and Price was perfect.    We will still support sister restaurants Monta and Goyemon, but we will NOT return to this restaurant until this new lady is gone.

7C2pwbMcsjzOLb7uLeeg0g.text: Excellent sushi!! I came here for the first time and it was all you an eat sushi. What a deal, and it even included desert. I will come back when I'm in town forsure.

mn_iyghDnMOq0qql8s5cgQ.text: My office eats here at least once a week.  Sushi Mon is the clear leader for AYCE.  The chefs, Hiro, Mike and Song are skilled and friendly.  You will love this sushi.  The nigiri is outstanding but the rolls are tasty as well.  Give it a try.  You will be glad you did.

aN--0IEESmwmMXzm34cLXw.text: Had the all-you-can-eat. Service was fast, the salmon belly was excellent, though the regular salmon nigiri was so so. They have punch cards so if you come in lots you get a free all-you-can-eat. The salmon tail collar was a little dry. everything else was great.

49d-av64qAMT7_wnss4XZw.text: Can't even believe the management here! We had an incident here where the server dropped the tray of ice cold water on my 11 month old son. The tray, the cup, and the water on his head. He was soaked from head to toe and in tears. Now, I know accidents happen but first of all it could have been prevented by not holding a tray over a baby's head. Second, when something like this happens, I would have thought the manager would have come over to make sure my son was ok... Nope all we got was a sorry from the waiter and then he started to clean the water up. So I went back to the restrooms which were both taken at the time, waited there for a minute and just decided to take my son out to the car to change him and calm him down... Once again waiting for the manager to come up to us. So by the time I got to the car I was just livid. All I wanted to do was leave. I knew if I had stayed I would have ripped someone a new one.   On the way home I called the manager and spoke to him. He was no help what so ever and was claiming that the reason he didn't walk up to us was because "we were in the bathroom"... Which we weren't... And "we walked outside"... Which he still could have came to check on us and make sure my sone was ok. Excuses excuses! One he started to talk over me and would listen to what I was saying, I hung up.   Needless to say I will never come back and neither will my family and friends.

6fKVQRExAJl82cOq1NnJ3w.text: Workers here stare at you while you eat to make sure you are really eating your rice with your sushi. We went as soon as they open for lunch and today's special Kanpachi was written on the board, but then when we ordered 5 of those, they said they don't have any more and erased from the board. After we came out, I saw them writing Kanpachi on the board again. Foods tasted alright. Don't do the all-you-can-eat if you are so concerned about how much we eat. We were not satisfied to come back.

vSygLcm0JLypNu3e60DIjA.text: I'm pretty surprised to see all these mediocre ratings for sushi mon! My experience today was far from those low reviews, if anything I'd say that the quality and service was probably one of the best I've had from any sushi place in a long time!!! My boyfriend and I did AYCE as usual, and at $27 we thought it was pretty pricy, but stayed anyway since it had been a year since we'd last been here. We love to order nigiri, so I'll try to remember everything:   -tuna -garlic tuna  -tako -salmon  -blue fin toro  -euro sea bass  -poki -ebi  -yellowfin  - 1/2 911 roll - 1/2 a chi chi  - 1/2 sexy girl  - 1/2 crispy rice   I can't go into detail describing every dish since it's all pretty self explanatory and the last 4 specialty rolls I forget what was in them :(  I will tell you this though, the quality of the fish was superb, especially the salmon belly and toro (it melted in your mouth!) but the best part was the quantity of fish!!! Some places they give you a huge chunk of rice with a thin later of fish... Not here, not this time! Thick ass pieces!! Excuse my language, I'm just that excited!!! And our chef, BEN, was super nice, explained every kind of fish, their delivery dates, and even made us some nice nigiri pieces that were not on the menu. This totally made the price well worth it, and the staff weren't awkward when we ordered half their inventory, like we usually do when we order sushi.  We also arrived right after the lunch menu, 4pm, so it was not crowded and noisy, and had all their attention!!   Great place, friendly staff, superb service, and superior quality and quantity of fish. Shout out to Ben once again for the service!!!  Thank god I wore my stretchy pants today!!!

fhzH86eyrCC84tJYFcAjYQ.text: Can't believe they handled our party of 16 (12 at one table and 4 at one table).  We totally demolished it - lots of nigiri, spider rolls, specialty rolls, baked salmon skin rolls, shrimp tempura, tuna poke, and more.  They did not add in an auto gratuity and credited us one AYCE meal on our current bill through their stamp program.  This place is small but they churn out the sushi.

MXzdv70yWgWP3ONJCeP1Vw.text: Amazing fresh sushi! I'm usually skeptical about where I eat sushi but this place was really clean! They have a lot of sauces also to choose from which I love.. The yum yum sauce is a must try.. It's like a sweet spicy mayo sooooo good. Another cool thing was they had a picture for every roll they serve so you can get a look at it before ordering

Hs_2jhdy59V0lABaWgaq2w.text: If you are in a hurry this is not the place for you. All you can eat sushi for 60 minutes. Waiting 20 minutes for a roll doesnt add up to a good dining experience. Servers come by and ask if there is anything else we want to order, I told her I am still waiting on my order from 20 minutes ago. Sushi is average. Same as the next place. Will not be returning.

knIQlljp9vRzIIBD5rEjuA.text: We eat here often but damn today the fish was so old. My husband and I both started to feel sick after our 2nd role. The crab smelled so fishy and the rolls tasted old even tho they made it  in Front of us.  I don't think we will be going back a

oPNzNQn5_UC236aBPX1W5A.text: My father and I cane here for dinner. The restaurant is clean. The chefs and waiters are friendly. The fish is clean. They serve accordingly. Major key (the fish taste very clean). The ambiance is happy and fun. I finished with a delicious green tea mochi.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Came here for dinner. The fish taste very fresh. They serve accordingly. The chefs are pretty cool and friendly. Clean and happy Ambiance.

XIn6D1tygVfgKQf8n0L2_g.text: When we arrived the environment was peaceful and everyone greeted us. Our waiter was very nice and attentive. I had my 2 year old with me who was a little rowdy but the staff did their best to make my daughter calm and I was satisfied overall. Their sushi is delicious and the service is fast and accurate!

yApPjQLrQ8JKmfiE8S-VpQ.text: ***Yelp Challenge 2016 1/100***  Love sushi and especially salmon belly! I always stick with nigri. I like to keep it real! LOL I love mixing things up and getting things like ikura and quail egg. One thing about lunch here is that they don't have uni available. It's ok though. They have many others to choose from. The super white tuna, poke and orgasm salad were all UNO!   The chef was also super cool. He had a smile the entire time. I recommend this spot to anyone looking to try something different. It's not as packed as the location on eastern. Also don't forget to ask for your stamp car for all you avid sushi eaters! If you don't want it you can give it to me haha JK Happy Sushi Eating. This place will not disappoint.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ikura with uni - tako wasabi - salmon belly and fresh wasabi is so good! Don&#39;t settle for imitation!

2Kbq-xCBEmKFDrDXSskYOg.text: We have been here before several times. This past weekend my family and I went to the restaurant and something was different and I was not able to pinpoint it. There weren't that many customers during dinner on a weekend. The food also tasted different and my daughter even said the tuna was not the same as before. When we sat down, I showed the staff the stamp card and he said he will check with the manager. He came back and said it was okay as long as it has the location on the stamp card. We continued with our meal. When it was time to pay, the lady brought us the bill and I showed her the stamp card and she said they do not accept the stamp card at that location because they are under new management. We had no clue that Sushi Mon on Sahara is no longer part of the Mon Restaurant  Group and it was not posted that they are under new management. We will not be back to this location.

jy_XjwMeOubPjZniFZMvrQ.text: For an AYCE (made to order) I really like this place. They give you a stamp card, and I've been able to redeem 2 this year, that means I got 20 meals (not all myself, i brought guests) so I'm officially hooked. There are a lot of AYCE sushi places to choose from in town now. The new management has taken the food quality up a notch. The high end stuff is back, Toro, Uni, Salmon Belly and Amaebi. The hot dishes are very tasty, tempura is fluffy and crispy, salads are fresh. But do NOT share if you are not paying for All-You-Can-Eat, the make it really uncomfortable for you if you try to slide one by. Mochi for dessert is the best.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States

snuY2pPjBzckQLhBQBhbaQ.text: Well, I tried a sampling of 4 different offerings, and a few that my wife ordered: Poke salad with tuna was the tiniest salad I have ever seen. I have been to many sushi places and I have watched good ones come and go. Arata is MUCH better, but is only average. Yama used to be good, but tumbled downhill.  and one piece was very chewy, obviously being a mistake. My wife ordered combo tempura, which was good, except one item was nearly raw potato that I was required to eat. Not a good situation! Next I got a full roll that had way too much eel sauce, and was therefore EXTREMELY SALTY. The next item I ordered was called "Volcano", but instead of being torched like you would expect, a pile of gooey, heated slop is thrown on top. Not very pleasant from my point of view. I took a friends advice that this was a good place. I cannot imagine why I would go here again, even if it was free! The food is bland and forgetable. My friend goes there often. He must order something different. All in all,  ate until I was full, and will not return. I tried my wife's Hurricane roll. Also bland. It's fortunate that the ginger and wasabi were okay, so the food had at least a little bit of flavor.

gBQBQsTm9ofiLB2zmVuLng.text: Been coming to this Sushi Mon location for over 6 years. Seen both owner and staff changes over the years. I've also witnessed how drastically the food quality and service has changed yet we chose to come and eat at this place. Today, came in for AYCE with my husband and kids (5 year old and 16 month old) My son is allergic to seafood so we brought his own food to eat as what we've always done in the past but today we were told that we can no longer bring outside food. Also, they told me that they have charge my 16 month old extra $3.00 because she was eating off of my plate. (One piece of sushi and edamame)  I think it's just ridiculous but really? I thought it was a joke but server was serious. Nevertheless, today will be the last time we are coming here. This place just lost a loyal customer for years!!! By the way, good luck finding unagi on their caterpillar roll since they put so little to none!!!

OxnAh-7knqpDLAz2vdLLmg.text: They had some pretty good rolls . I like that it wasn't overly crowded . All in all the experience was good . I do wish they had a little more variety in the desserts , but everything else was ok.

mqIS9Wai1cSlKeOs4FUQ6w.text: My family & I have been coming here for quite awhile and have never had a bad experience. We used to order the all-you-can-eat but have recently discovered that it is more cost efficient for us to place our sushi orders a-la-carte. For a family of 4 the all-you-can-eat runs $108 but the last time we went there we ordered a-la-carte and our total bill was in the mid-$50's. Also, we didn't feel the need to overly stuff ourselves like you do when you order the all-you-can-eat and walked out not feeling uncomfortable from over-eating.

PDh3bJxQRNWOCQx32-PMUw.text: My friend came to town and told me about this place. We ended up going 3 days in a row for all you can eat sushi. The staff and especially the chef that we had all three times were very nice and the food was even better. This now one of my favorite places to go in Vegas

hm6Zh83svnwn7ksof_Zp9w.text: Main sushi chef is gone, heard they changed the ownership. That's why they serve sushi worse then ever. Their fish are too dry and most roll came unrolled. Crappy skills. Their customer service got worse as well. The lady at front (maybe new owner or manager?) seemed nice, but she's not even paying attention to the customers. I understand when it's busy I don't complain this much. Our group didn't get refills or orders unless we asked. I miss the good chef and the previous management. Go to Goyemon instead.

Yl7l4MQ7ZXp7PpEHru8WLw.text: I gave my opinion when i checked in. Not the greatest sushi place. I just ate here coz it's close to my house.  Should have had pizza instead

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States

a662-O5ECtY7omdkySgakA.text: My Favorite Sushi Place Helen is always so friendly actually takes the time to know her guest The Chef Is Soo awesome  The whole staff is so friendly...

c_1mLI4f3wH22xnTcvX7Nw.text: This is our go to place for sushi for my husband and I. Great service, decently priced menu and best of all, ayce!

fQ3CjMp8FU8bPzJquaNYyw.text: This has been my favorite spot for sushi going on a few years now. Just made another visit yesterday and had excellent service for lunch. I recommend the ecstasy roll..it is my favorite!! I also brought a friend with me and it was his first time eating sushi, which he loved!  If you want fresh food, come here!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ecstasy roll

hLDCw3hWFKRgSw05XWNn4A.text: Went here for lunch. The price was decent but some of the rolls weren't the best. The service was surprisingly slow for the time we went. Not that many people in there. I would go back again!

svFquFrJAYxGrH0MLIwCEA.text: The staff and service were a little slow in providing the AYCE orders. I'm glad they don't actually keep time on the 60 minutes of AYCE because you wouldn't be getting a lot with their pace. Overall, the food was satisfying. It filled me up, and I felt like I got a good bang for my buck. The aftermath of the sushi, when I returned home was not quite great. Had an upset stomach and some pains after this meal, not sure if it was due to bad fish or what. If I didn't get sick after the meal, I probably would have given 4 stars.

VRHnzevcIqsrgIxZ45J7uw.text: This is the 3rd time we've eaten here and the sushi is always fresh. It's a small restaurant so there can be a wait. It about 15min outside of the strip but it's worth the drive. They serve sweet shrimp sushi and white tuna which are my favorites here. I only order sushi so I don't know about the other dishes. The last time my wife and I came here we waited about 20min which wasn't bad. If you enjoy fresh sushi this is the place to go.

RgLA2YwJ53xoeMMgc7L7oA.text: Teriyaki chicken was disgusting. I had heard good things about this place. I was terribly disappointed. I won't ever go back.

cRKoIxJRPYkyRaJqbRA2Rg.text: Went here last night with a group of people. First off you walk in and there is the smell of sewer. Big no no with me. Asked for manager and everybody acts like that's normal for that smell. They have fans blowing when you sit down for a reason. Food is good. We tried pretty much everything on the menu. I agree with other posts on the staff except for one server who stood out from the rest. If she leaves the place is screwed.  They do use a hand held computer for orders which is good.

XJKHXO5Qo6Ha_n1qgTAizw.text: To be honest I gerneally do not make it out to that side of town, although I had a friend working over there and decided to meet her for dinner. With that being said, I arrived early (which is unusual for me) although once there they would not allow me to get a table till our entire party was there. Which placed me sitting akwardly in front of the door in everyones way, rather than at the table. Not happy about this already. The sushi was not necessarily bad, although there was nothing fantastic about it either. All you can eat makes sense when you have a large party... When time to leave our checks were wrong and they could not straighten it out, so we just paid and left. I am just not at big fan! Most likely not going to go back. (Mainly because my regular sushi place is closer, cleaner, better quality of food, and more inviting.) Not to horrible but I don't suggest it. That's just my honest review. Good day.

E1ziVerWdiOBt6ogXiQ-Xw.text: Prices are reasonable, considering that it's Japanese food. The food is really good.

S5_ZQitqcxppM-M1A-qdNA.text: I had been here once before which the customer service was a lot better I think it was because we were being attended by the Sushi chefs. I went in recently again decided to take my cousin from LA to go have some all you can eat which turned out to be a nightmare the waitress brought us out our 1st order when we where going to order more she looked at my cousins plate and told her she had to eat that and pointed, we did'nt notice anything because we finished everything she came over again and got the plate and pointed at literaly 5 pieces of rice grains and told her again she had to eat that before ordering more well she did so we ordered more and finally it was time for dessert I dont eat sweets but my 6yr old son kept asking for Mango Mochi being that its included in the all you can eat I figured sure no problem as long as it get's eaten well here she comes again heard my son say "mommy mango mochi" she looked at me and said "he cannot eat the ice cream" I said "excuse me? it's included in my all you can eat as long as it gets eaten there shouldnt be any problem it's not like I was feeding my kid sushi he had his own order of teryaki." she said "Those are the rules"  I told her to just bring it to me but she was waiting for me to say he wasnt going to eat it before she brought it I did not say that because the DAMN ICE CREAM was for my son not me. HORRIBLE service I get the all you can eat rules but this lady went overboard which cost her, her tip.

69VdEQKl4rfJhuIw0rBFJw.text: can't really say I'm a big fan of this place.. to be fair the food is actually very good. they have a great variety of the special rolls on the AYCE menu and ive never had a bad experience as far as taste goes... the servers are the only problem. every time ive eaten here ive usually had a mid 20s male server along with an older woman and they always make me feel rushed. its like im bothering them when I ask for a refill. last time I went we had ordered our last 2 plates along with mochi ice cream at the same time and before the food could even get to use the servers began taking our plates and drinks away... i wasn't even finished eating! i told them i didn't want the last of the food I ordered that they began to bring out and asked for the bill and left. will definitely not go back, it was the last straw service wise. go here if you must for the good quality food, but be warned about these servers.

aTP04Y9gQKyQK77MbEK0PQ.text: Not a fan of this place my husband and I have raved about this place for years it's been awhile since we've been in so I decided to have lunch there with my mom I ordered three rolls of California rolls when I got them I could barely taste the crab and the roles were very small the Cucumber normally has the peel outer skin shaved off but they kept it on making it very hard to chew when the rest of the scroll is soft it jabbed me in top of the mouth every time the avocado was so thin I didn't even taste it definitely would not recommend this place to anyone and do not plan on returning back I also ordered vegetable tempura it was definitely supersaturated and oil and cooked very quickly as opposed to them being dried and the tempura overall looking a lot better I just peeled off the outer breading and eat the vegetables no big the cucumber salad that we ordered once again was 50% skin and 50% cucumber not yummy will you have to chew the crap out of your cucumber salad I ordered two drinks two dr. Peppers they were a buck seventy-five apiece not bad I was done eating my three orders of sushi - 3 small bites and I asked the lady for a to-go cup she told me I'm sorry we don't have to go cups I don't understand how I can pay for a drink and not take it that's not right I paid for all of my stuff alicart and it was not all you can eat there should be no reason why they shouldn't offer to go cup I don't think that is good service at all so I sat there and extra 30 minutes while I drink my drink and that time I stared at the check and realize they forgot to charge me for the drinks mind you I was upset that they didn't have a to-go cup I thought that was rude but I wanted to make sure that they didn't offer the drinks because if that was the case I had no right to complain about not having a to-go cup the lady said to me oh no she forgot to charge you so me being the nice person I am cuz I could have said that's your problem not mine I had her fix the bill to charge me for two drinks but seriously there was maybe four people in that shop and you forget to add the bill correctly I definitely will not be back and I will make sure the people know my opinion when it comes to Sushi Mon I will definitely be returning to Sushi 21 on Flamingo and Decatur it is worth the drive because apparently nothing close to me is halfway decent

83jng748BivMQW2pSPC6ZA.text: This was my favorite AYCE sushi spot at one time. That was before the new owner started changing everything in here. The changes that really hurt this place is the staff and the menu.  There have been more changes since I was last there. Now there is a new sushi counter. I liked the previous counter better than the new one. The motor for the refrigeration unit seems to give off a lot of heat towards the end of the counter. Not to mention the counter was filthy where I sat down. Not only was the counter top filthy, but there was a bug in my daughters volcano roll. I handed the dish back to the guy behind the sushi bar and he set the plate down on the counter where they were preparing sushi.  I would also like to know why there are no Asian people working there anymore? This is an Asian restaurant, is it not? The other owner had Japanese sushi chefs. Now the new owner just hires anyone to roll up fish and rice. I'm not saying you have to be Japanese to make sushi, but come on man. Where is the authentic vibe that used to be here? It's just like a fast food place now. All they need is a drive through window.  Well, I can say after seven years of frequenting this establishment, I won't be back. I'm not feeling the new Sushi Mon. It use to be my favorite place. What a shame.

JaqfNBA6meiOelp43dJuuQ.text: Excellent. We did the all you can eat with half orders. Fresh and tasty. Because the sushi and service were great.

BLV1GDygrM2sqhDtoXF0hw.text: Firstly, this place smells like sewage.  It's not a random event, it's every day.  Don't be deterred and expect to wait.  It's worth it.  This is our regular place.  The staff doesn't change and neither does the quality.  Don't expect fancy over the top rolls to delight your Instagram followers.  Do expect lots of sashimi choices.  Get a punch card, you will be back.  Consistency is where it's at here.  Also, lunch is cheaper with mostly all the same items.  Order the Cajun albacore and the baked mussels... you will be glad you did.  Lastly, if it's your first time, order half rolls so you can try everything.  Happy sushi eating.

Ba64Ayf_K6KS-Zmb0U7HYw.text: Well, I've been to a ton of sushi places, but a few reasons why me and my gf seem to always come back to this place. EdlDG5DeBnaPaIx3WVu2gw.text: NEVER GO TO THIS PLACE! Theres lots of sushi places in town to choose from, not worth being treated bad. I had a party of 13 with me and we were all present and there is a sign on the door that says 80% of your party must be present before being seated. There was a section for us to be seated but there was a party of 2 waiting on 3 more, that was hindering us to sit as a family. I asked them to have those 2 to get up and wait but they refused, I asked for a manager but no manager present. Now we were forced to sit at the bar, now I couldn't talk to my cousins on the otherside. It was supposed to be a wonderful family outing which turned horrible as we couldn't catch up with each other and couldn't communicate. At The end of the dinner, they were 3 extra rolls because we all couldn't communicate of who is ordering what and our servers couldn't tell us what was coming. So the server decided to charge us for the extra rolls. I asked them that why you made an exception for them breaking the rules but not us? I've been coming to this place for years and I'm always bringing 10-16 party with me. If not a large party, it's just my family of 3 or 4 and we eat there 2-3 times a month. I'm always in good hands with Ulyiss as be is always making sure our drinks are full and empty plates gets removed. But with this experience, never again and now I'm aware of all these social media review, I'm making sure non of my friends or family gets treated that way. I even had the server agree that I had all my party preset but sat a different party that WAS NOT 80% present.

UPA7FIhafedRxSdQF1Tn4Q.text: Hait! We're supposed to be in Vegas but end-up in Japan. We are the couple that must find at least one best Japanese restaurant anywhere we go because hubby was an ex-sensei and I'm a forever sashimi-eater. So here we are. We came to Sushi Mon for dinner with hubby's family (the Vegas residence) before, but this time we came for lunch with his nephew. We had a great lunch. They ordered "all you can eat" and I ordered chirashi bowl. So I cannot eat all that I can because "all you can eat" cannot be shared but I was happy with my order. Who needs to eat it all? Most sushi place in Vegas have this type of promotion, all you can eat, surprise that everyone seems to be able to follow this "all you can eat" trend. The servers are Japanese but the four sushi chefs are mixed, could be Japanese and Chinese but I saw one was teaching the other, one was focusing on filleting, one was on a cell phone (kidding!). Of course no one's on a cell phone here, hello! Anyway, the lunch was great and we would come back here, for sure. Someday I'll try that "all you can eat" thing and see whether it's True that I could eat it all! Enjoyed it, thanks! Recommended.

EHrWIW8005cSQxVDZuRSAA.text: Update: had a pretty awesome AYCE meal here last weekend. Sat in front of the friendly Kazu-san and had a good time. Incredibly tender unagi. Nice salmon belly and yellowtail belly. Very buttery toro. Sushi rice in the nigiri was on the warm side, and loosely packed - and I appreciated that. All of the nigiri was prepared like this. Kazu-san's got skills!  I was also served a perfectly broiled Yellowtail Collar - medium rare. Delicious. The scallop sushi was very firm and fresh - the closest to live I've had in nigiri form. (Sushi Koma's scallop sushi is rather slimy+fishy in comparison.)  My new hand roll rule: Only order hand rolls one-at-a-time at the sushi bar *only* (to maintain a crispy nori cone). Makes all the difference. Your hand roll nori will become a soggy latex funnel if you let it sit for more than 20 seconds. Gobble it up as soon as it is made!  I am again a big fan of the 'new' Sushi Mon. Great service, little or no wait time, and a convenient location for West-siders. I *do* enjoy the kitchen food at Sushi Koma a little more (e.g. their Tostada, their gyoza) but as far as straight-up sushi goes, Sushi Mon is fantastic.

utGn9dWuu1gKCj5zY4AZHg.text: It might be our 10th time here and it's the first time in my life that I don't have to speak to order the chef Sung already know exactly what I am looking for me and my girlfriend. Very good quality awesome ambiance, great service and best food. Well done !!!

r4ssWHe3J94M3nNzsUJwqA.text: This place has changed so it deserves a new review.  First off, they eliminated fountain drinks in favor of $1.99 (or so) per CAN of soda/iced tea/etc. This move was clearly about the money cause you can get pretty thirsty with all that rice they add onto the sushi (yes, a nice amount of rice with a slightly less proportioned slice of fish).   Then, they replaced my Sushi Mon card with a location limited Sushi Mon card without my permission (meaning if I had most of my stamps from the other Sushi Mon location, say for example, because I live closest there and I frequent that location the most, I can no longer go to that location with my stamp card I'm forced to go to the Sahara location as it says it's limited to that location only).   I've been coming here for over 10 years (that's right), and sadly, I've watched it decline from what it once was when i would first go there. My friend and I were waiting 10 minutes till we received our 5 orders of salmon, while the table who was seated 10 minutes after we were seated got their order of 2 rolls within 10 minutes of being seated. This continued until I complained to the waiter, pointing out how full their table had gotten with food ordered from the sushi bar, in comparison to us who have only been served a small amount of items within a larger span of time. It made me pretty unhappy but after I pointed it out we magically began getting 3-4 other orders to our table within 15 mins , much like the table beside us.   The one thing that their menu has that no other AYCE restaurant has is halibut. The quality of the fish is good, the service is lacking... still.   It's also extremely annoying when you're at the bar and constantly having to remind the chefs what you ordered, it'd be nice if they gave you a paper to fill out cause it can be hard getting their attention.   This was a review and a rant at my bad experience from the other week. But here's my overall summary:  5/10 Customer Service (consistently) 8/10 Quality Of Sushi (some days there have been an "off" taste)  They fixed the rotten egg smell, woohoo !

gp8s3a3K07R7I6Pt5DFfMw.text: Went here on a Thursday for alyce for lunch. I had a feeling I should've just gotten a bento so it would be simple and easy, but i really craved sushi. I should've listened to my gut feeling.   It took them 20 MINUTES to give me my 2 orders for salmon nigiri and a half lemon roll. It wasnt even busy. Even when I've been to multiple sushi places that were much busier than this place, it has NEVER taken 20 minutes for a simple order. Then my server forgot to write down my other order so i had to wait another 10 minutes for another 2 half rolls.   I had to flag her down twice to get the status of both orders. Just absolutely ridiculous. They didnt even try to remedy the issue. She gave my friend a coupon for free ayce but there was "nothing we can do" about messing up my orders. Really? Because you're just handing out free sushi coupons. NOT at all worth the money if youre going to wait 20 minutes for 4 pieces of sushi. Urgh. What a waste of my money.

Qa1-GPC1kpSzWJVN5VE02g.text: Quite good for a very low cost sushi.   The fish portions were generous and did not have huge portions of rice. The curry rice was good. I ordered the combo: - sushi was unexpectedly good for the price. (wasn't expecting much) -tempura was decent -teriyaki beef was overcooked and tough. Overall it was great for the price.

3eCUI3_-wMu5sZBti6aE3Q.text: Our favorite AYCE sushi place. BUT NO MORE NEW PUNCH CARDS! Better use yours before they stop honoring them.

RSyQRoRtN9NDQNd5ONcE0w.text: I'm surprised at the low ratings with this place, because I believe this place is still the best ayce sushi joint in Vegas. Their fish quality is far better than the other ayce places around town, and I love how they have different daily specials. They might not have the fanciest nor most creative looking rolls, but they do their nigiri right. They had Kobe beef nigiri the second to the last time I was there, and it was uhh-maaay-jiiing! I also love their tempura and hamachi kama, which are all included in the ayce. I've heard people say they got charged extra with leftover rice, but if you sit at the sushi bar, you can request the sushi chefs to go easy on the rice.   Lunch is $21.95 and dinner is $26.95 (with the dinner price you can order uni and sweet shrimp with a 1 order limit per person). Service is always attentive and accommodating. I have been a fan of Sushi Mon since day one, and I will continue to keep coming.

You will be pleasantly surprised that this small place packs a huge punch with delicious food and great customer services. I went for the early lunch All You Can Eat and I had the Sexy Lady Sushi roll and it was amazing full of flavor and I couldn't get enough of it. The Spider roll was also a top pick and all the other appetizers I tried I really enjoyed. The staff from Chef to wait staff were really good and very attentive to our table. There's no shortage of parking and their restroom was very clean. The grand finale of my lunch was dessert and their Strawberry Monchi ice cream made my day. Be sure to get a stamp/initials to your loyalty card, because after 10 stamps you get a free dinner.

xgs5qciyTkG_SV6j98oGGw.text: I'm not going to lie, I took an edible before I went here with friends, who were also pretty high, but it didn't hit until about halfway through our all-you-can-eat meal, so I'm about 80% certain that you can still trust my judgement.  The sushi is made fresh to order, and it's all pretty incredible. I tried Uni and raw eel for the first time, and they were both a little different but overall very enjoyable. Their deep-fried rolls were savory and sweet, perfectly crunchy, and somehow still had beautifully raw tuna in the center. The nigiri were simply perfect, where I'm from a lot of the sushi places coat their fish in lemon juice to hide whether or not the fish is fresh, but there was nothing on their fish and it was very good.  I don't generally do desserts when I eat out, but I tried a taste of someone's lychee sorbet and I couldn't help but order some for myself. It was very smooth, and probably the only fruit-flavored frozen dessert that I'd EVER describe as decadent.   The service is VERY quick and friendly, we didn't have to wait between courses.  Overall I would say that I'd love to go here again!
