y6mwsdvfF-tT23IS233XzQ.text: One of the top ayce in town. Service is slow and can take minutes to hours to be seated because of how small the restaurant is. The food itself is great and is always delicious. Average pricing and creative rolls.

_1VzKteXbNDUxHGivrbMqg.text: Bad service. I tried sending two dry, tasteless rolls back and was given the check with no other food. I asked for another roll because I was still hungry and they said no, so I essentially paid $20 for some nigiri.

dGy1fa0N6bRYl6TbtUTE5A.text: Since I was doing some business on Sahara and my son wanted ayce sushi, we decided to give Sushi Mon a try since it was just a couple of driveways over.  My family and I were promptly seated.  The first thing that I noticed was how very small and limited their appetizer selection was.  We ordered sushi at the same time as our appetizers.  Some appetizers came out fairly quick, while others came much later.  Very small portions.  They also claimed to have been short on eel, so it was 1 order per person.  Never have I experienced that one before.  The 1st nigiri sushi we had ordered came out like 10 min after we placed our order, with the rest of our order nigiri coming out 1 plate at a time at about 10 min intervals.  Like others have said about horrible wait times, we waited 45 min for our 1st roll to arrive.  I don't understand what the problem was because 2 sushi chefs were working and their were only like 2 other tables occupied.  There must have been a shift change because a new sushi chef (asian man with glasses) kept staring at our table.  Finally a Korean lady asked if our waiter explained the time limt rules when we 1st arrived.  How are you going to enforce the time limit when it takes 45 min for the 1st roll to come out and it takes even longer for all the food you ordered 1 hour ago to arrive?  We frequent BF Sushi, being that we live on that side of town.  Large appetizer menu, great service, fast, courteous and never a time limit.  This place also loads you up on rice, whereas BF Sushi put like 1/4 the rice on their nigiri as this place.  One thing is for sure:  I will never come back and I will surely never recommend this place to anyone.  Save your money and go elsewhere.

xrXLiG_dMh9IGNTw0QSWvw.text: Everything is fresh and yummy!  Love the deserts!  We will definitely come back next time!!

NXU8oOBvHqzxrs-Ld2lNoQ.text: I decided to try this restaurant instead of my usual sushi place. The food was good and the prices seemed fair from the online menu, but I was not satisfied at all. I called in and ordered it for take out (my boyfriend and I wanted a nice night in for Valentine's Day). When I got there to pick it up, the staff was completely rude and said they had no record of my order so it was never even placed! They said it would be ready in 15 minutes. Fine. After FORTY-FIVE minutes went by, my order was finally "ready", but they forgot one of my rolls, and I had to wait even longer for it to be actually done! Then I got home. I was so disappointed! The rolls are so tiny that it reminded me of how gas station sushi looks - the entire roll could fit in my hand, not exaggerating! The couple extra bucks I would pay at my usual place doesn't seem so bad now. I definitely will not be a customer here again.

k9FY5ARM7wPVpw3f1dUlVQ.text: My boyfriend and I love this restaurant. We try to come for lunch or dinner at least once a month. The sushi here is so fresh, and we are both super picky. We moved over to this side of town and it is closer to us than our old place so we switched and we don't miss our old place at all. The sushi chefs are super friendly and serve it up with a smile. The wait staff is super attentive as well. I also love their rewards program! We eat there enough that it definitely makes it worth it. Recommended to all sushi lovers!

ns1qVtvZrcCtgX0HIlRTnA.text: I've came to this location a few times in the past whenever I come to Vegas. It's fairly off the strip but it's probably the best local spot that doesn't have the Vegas markup. Personally I rather eat this than a Vegas buffet. It's a small humble location in a plaza. The wait staff were super friendly and quick with their service. They do not skimp on anything. I would probably place this in my top 5 sushi spots.  The nigiri is super duper fresh! How do they even get fresh fish all the way out to Vegas!? The price is very typical but you really get your worth in quality. Dessert, drinks all included. I can't really say anything more.

hOJR61S6bkXbc0IDeud0Iw.text: Okay so went there for lunch today for the first time. I've been to the Maryland location and they were great and nice. Sushi chef was nice at saraha location.  Their tuna was kind of weird texture but other then that food was good.  I liked their masago roll, moon rool, and garlic edemame. The reason I give them 2 stars is because the manager charged me for literary not eating a HALF OF A SPOON of RICE I almost wanted to laugh it wasn't even a whole one peice of sushi. He wasn't nice at all about it.  I probably wont be going back to that location just because of him.

6cFNcq-9Ihw9wm74XDVkOg.text: Honestly, this place used to be one my favorite restaurants. My experience yesterday was so disappointing that I don't want to return ever again. The hostess or owner who was seating people made me so angry. Although we got there earlier than half of the people waiting, she refused to seat us. When I checked the waiting list, our names were on the top yet we weren't seated because the team of 7 who came after us. When ever there were empty seats in the bar, she didn't even ask us if we wished to take those seats. After three tables left and were empty, we still couldn't take those seats because the entire party of 7 weren't there. She continually waited for those people when their seating policy clearly states that the party won't be seated until the entire party is present. This experience was so disappointing and outrageous. Although sushi mon has great food, I won't be returning if this treatment continues.

A13CpaFAODyIwyGXllr7Ew.text: I know this restaurant is owned and managed by the same people as the one on the south side of town, but this one seems just a touch below, and I'm not sure why.  It's still great, and I've been here many times.  Same rolls and food are good here.  Do get: Futomaki Spider Roll Unagi Super White Tuna Yellowtail Collar Green Tea creme brulee Something with Scallop Yum on it

40qd8vKKcJUgrbDsXzCNYw.text: This review probably more to do with what Sushi Mon used to be and less about what it is now. Since new management took over, there no longer is Uni (which I actually don't like but feel like it added some value to the AYCE), Toro, Sake Shooters or unlimited sake Mon-Thu. I am not sure if it has actually gone up in price but it feels like it has and the value isn't as good as it used to be.   The fish here is still pretty solid, there is a crispy rice and tuna roll that is probably the best thing we had there. Also the chefs don't seem to be as heavy handed with the yuzu which was one of my main complaints in the past. The one thing I didn't like was the Ahi Poke bowl. It used to be a nice starter of just fresh pieces, now it has a lot of other things in the bowl which I did not appreciate. Still a place that is probably worth the AYCE price, and the food is good but it used to be better so I think I am comparing it to that

2yUlP4lchscLN5R21nnCuQ.text: Considering this is location is now a member of the Mon Restaurant Group, I guess it would be easiest to compare this place to Goyemon.  Not as many choices as Goyemon. Appetizer items such as kama, gyoza, yakitori, and even takoyaki. But you won't find any udon or ramen, grilled pork, spicy tuna on rice crackers, etc. There is a blackboard with daily special however.  The quality of the fish is similar to Goyemon or any other AYCE sushi restaurant, not Sushi Dai, but definitely not shark chum. The service was above average, but sometimes the chefs were a little distracted with the tv or chatting with each other.  I guess you can describe this Sushi Mon as "Goyemon-lite" or a little brother to Goyemon. It is a solid AYCE sushi addition to the west side of the valley for anyone who doesn't want to drive all the way to Sushi Mon's "older brother."

NRFC8ImNg1IO0SPmv-X3IA.text: The sushi cooks are super friendly and the food is great! Kiran, crispy rice roll, frying Jason and teriyaki chicken are amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy Rice Roll!!

j-11vEwZ-nP_7aK7IQpmTg.text: The first time I came here I was not impressed it smelled funky and decor looked old and boring, and servers  were eh, one of my friends had tried this place again recently and told me it was amazing! Because it was under new management, and I was hesitant but I trust her so we came here for lunch and it was amazing!!!! The salmon that I had  tried before was disgusting and now it was delicious! Whatever they are doing now they are doing it right! Keep it the way it is and I'll be a permanent customer

WzlvEWqF2bXPcZ7N_HEeBw.text: awesome prices awesome food and they are generous with it! i can't forget to mention the great service. this is my new sushi spot! i highly recommend it

ZE7q1VAXG0gGI-gUf5Z0nQ.text: One star for having roaches and poor service.   First time trying out this location with my boyfriend. (He's tried the one on Maryland and loved it; we go to Goyemon -my favorite, on Decatur all the time).  Sat around for ten minutes at the bar before we ordered some rolls (AYCE of course). The rolls took a while to be made (very slow in comparison to all other AYCE sushi restaurants) especially considering how many customers were dining. It was just us, another couple, and one other lady. Luckily I eat pretty slow so I wasn't kept waiting too long between rolls. My boyfriend, however, really had to slow down his pace and did have to wait for new rolls. Btw, there were four sushi chefs working behind the bar. You definitely need to order as much as you can when you figure out what you want or else you will be waiting a while for your food to come.   The server didn't come and take the drink order until after our food already came. Again, keep in mind that they made the rolls relatively slow (and we only made two nigiri and two half roll orders). So we were already eating by the time she brought our two waters.   Skip to the end of the meal...after we order dessert we notice a baby roach crawling on the menu right in front of us on the bar. We didn't make a big deal (as gross as it was); my boyfriend just squished its guts out with his napkin. But to make matters worse, when we were brought our bill, they charged us for dinner instead of lunch. We brought it to their attention that we were already seated by 3:50 (dinner doesn't start until 4:00 and we weren't going to pay an extra $10 when we didn't even order any dinner specials -namely the green tea creme brulee  which I love). The server then came back and informed us that their computer said that we came in at 4:10 and that's when I called bull. I specifically remembered looking at the clock when we got our waters and it was 4:07. Again, we waited forever for our drinks, and if we got the drinks at 4:07 then how the hell did we walk in and get seated at 4:10? They finally decided to CORRECT the bill from dinner to lunch, but our whole experience was already ruined at that point. Will definitely not be making a return to this restaurant.

OJT0sAdwWsYgPm0SGDjjcw.text: So fresh! Great sushi chefs with great personalities! This is Goyemon II but without the crispy rice cakes ( for now...they are coming soon). My boyfriend said to give it a one star because he doesn't want it to get crowded! Lol! Really great sushi and AYCE too!

MCn6FCquefVTZU7aHMNJ-A.text: I have been coming to this location lately instead of Goyemon for my AYCE fix.  My wife and I have dined here five times in the last two months and have never had to wait to be seated which is a nice change of pace.  Servers and Sushi Chefs are all very friendly and greet you with a boisterous "Irasshaimase!" Our favorites include the Hurricane roll, Crispy Rice roll, and Yellowtail Nigiri.

fvR_lYedKx_ZnMYbJ2QRUA.text: Ok, so I said that I was gonna boycott Sushi Mon, but this location had much better customer service than the one on Silverado and Maryland. Service was fast and friendly, down to the servers clearing our used plates to refilling our drinks. AYCE is the way to go! I'd drive here for sushi and the good service than going to their other location!

6Ol21fp0lHmhUvqqVNt_Pw.text: This is an amazing sushi restaurant! Fast service, quality food, and friendly staff! Thank you for one hell of a Sunday lunch. I recommend the hurricane roll, sexy girl roll, and the super white tuna!

e62Vd03dVkM5q0YRxvWVPA.text: Sushi Mon have become our default sushi place. We always do ayce lunch and order a lot of nigiris. The fish were as fresh as you could hope for here in vegas -- comparable to goyemon (another favorite sushi place). Their rolls were good though none stands out -- but they will make you custom rolls which is great! Aside from our usual nigiris: super white tuna, yellow tail, salmon, eel, red snapper; we always order: frying jason, volcano, dragon roll, mussels, orgasmic salad and whatever else is on the daily special board. They have a more extensive (with grilled fish) dinner menu so its also worth going there for dinner but 808 sushi offers more grilled fish than sushi mon so thats where we go if we feel like having sushi/grilled fish for dinner.  Sushi Mon's service was great and friendly. We get our orders without noticing how long it has been... And we order a lot to get our money's worth! The flow of food coming our way was exceptional and they always refill our teas. The place is small enough that wait staff always see you if you're trying to get their attention.   One thing i will always come back here for is their lychee sherbet!!! There's not a lot of restaurants here that serve lychee sherbet... its always worth the drive to have a little of this treat!

Yb_cXSEV5KwvVLa_qS00jg.text: Great sushi and good service!  We went with the all you can eat and ordered almost everything on the menu.  Tip: if you go with the all you can eat, order half rolls so that you can try more things on the menu.  The servers are very attentive and fast.  We will come back for more..

NaAxttuqqQw3tcfl0RBiZQ.text: Best sushi in Las Vegas. Sushi chefs are great. Hiroshima is so nice. And fish is fresh.

nvz-DZ8ZcJzuNXQorC4REg.text: It took me a while thinking about write this review. I'm crazy with sushi-mon. My husband always call me a sushi monster !!  I usually go to sushi mon around 2-3 times a month for at least 2 years. When I heard they changed the owner I wasn't care but somehow the feeling of enjoyment has changed too! The food is 4 stars for me.  The new upgraded design was nice but the service is getting worst every time I go there.   I've always enjoying the service and conversation with couple Thai ladies and Yuki ( I think that was her name ) They are seem very polite, give us attentions and make the place feel welcome, But lately I haven't seen them much ( maybe my schedule have changed ) I went there on Thursday night (3/13/14) it was 3 groups of people only and I still received a shitty service from them!   The waitress were so MEAN!! For some reason which is I do not understand at all. We are a customer who going to give you tips and pay for what we eat!  We are not begging you for a free food!!! There were No smile No Hello No goodbye  No thank you!!! Just a simple unhappy face like this :(  When I ordered she do not give me and signal that she got it just walk away. When she brought the food she just drop it next to me not even in front of me then walk away.  We have to waved to get their attention. It was horrible.   We are hoping that the service somehow get better. Maybe I'll go back maybe I won't.

PrcO40CHxtZXXn65tHyr0A.text: My sister and I have been coming to Sushi Mon for more than a year and we always leave satisfied! The servers are always super nice and coming around to take more sushi orders and refill the drinks. And I love that they offer half rolls so we can try more of the menu and not fill up on was one or two rolls. I love the garlic edamame and the ecstasy roll! I always start and finish with it! Oh and they even have a punch card! We've already gone through two!!

pgQcdyL5rTbDrzpa-HJWKQ.text: The all you can eat is an amazing deal!! We got so much good quality food for a great price! Everything on the menu is included in the deal and it is all high quality.  I lived in Japan for 3 1/2 year, and while the quality here is not quite at that level, it is amazingly great for the states and phenomenal considering its in the desert!  Highly highly recommend!

PdANr5n2Z4hW4uW06pMyCg.text: Good sushi...HORRIBLE SMELL INSIDE!  Cant take that gosh awful sewer smell EVERYTIME!    Go there and see what I mean but bring a clothespin.

GHG7abI3Gdz7MDoZ8mCgRg.text: I liked here sushi quality. Perfect amount of rice. Chefs were very friendly. Clean and good atmsphere.

-ACt60-lsOODG2Rj6O1Hkw.text: This Sushi-Mon is in my hood and recently was purchased by the Mon group, should be AWESOME right since Goyemon is the businesssssss. A decrease in the hour wait time, some delicious grilled pork belly, and various other delicious appetizers.  To echo Jen S. this is a goyemon-lite. They have some of the same appetizers, some of the same specials, and some of the same desserts. They also probably have the same quality fish assuming its the same supplier, but its definitely not the same here. The fish cuts are weird, the assembly of the sushi is different, and the rice is cool. When I say cool I don't mean cool like the button you're gonna hit after reading my review, but cool temperature. Perhaps they don't have the same rice warmer as Goyemon, but to eat cold uni and cold rice, blehhhhh.  Better than some AYCE places, but I will be continue my travels to Goyemon land.

ZXb5KyEeDKh6PDAEAfUDhQ.text: OMG? talk about all you can eat sushi.   One of the best thing about Las Vegas. The service and food was great. The chef was very friendly and offered us some really sushi. Definitely one of the best experience in town. He is from Hawaii which made the conversation more comfortable. Although you can only have ama ebi, you can have all your can each ama ebi shrimp heads (which is my favorite). The salmon special was good and huge. Everything else was so delicious, I can't wait to go back.

RXFlh1RphPu3W_k5R0g9gg.text: We went for lunch and passed on the AYCE, so I do not know what that experience would have been like but it seems a common theme amongst many reviews here.  Ordering off the menu was a fine, the combination box offered chicken, tuna, salmon, California roll, tempura, rice, salad and miso soup. Sushi was very tasty and the drinks menu reasonably priced. The spot was well frequented by locals, always a good sign for out of town visitors like my group. Atmosphere pretty plain, we sat at one of the few tables that feel squeezed in.  Contrary to other reviews we saw only Japanese sushi chefs working behind the bar. We saw the ACYE option during lunch, the dinner menu offers more options than the lunch. Given the rather strict rules including the 45 minute time limit, I doubt we would have tried it anyway.

2BMQdD39uYWzbcCw4nioeA.text: My husband and I have been coming here for almost 2 years almost weekly. The last two times we came the service was SO slow. We were actually there for an hour yesterday and got 1 roll each. We were told they hadn't even started making our other food yet. When we got there it was dead slow! About 20 minutes in it got very busy. That's fine it's busy. But if I'm waiting an hour for rolls they shouldn't be falling apart as I pick them up. It was awful. We finally just paid for what we had received so far and cancelled our other order. 90 minutes total we were there. $25 check with no tip left and my husband and I each ate a single roll. We will not be coming back.

XHgca4AYcC5yv6GJYafMGQ.text: My husband and I stop by here whenever we're in Vegas and their sushi is great! I'm not talking about teriyaki chicken or non sushi items.   Their fish is always fresh and their fish cuts are always bigger than their rice portions.  I highly recommend this place and I usually don't leave reviews. I just felt like there were many people giving poor reviews on non sushi items, but you go to an all you can eat to order sushi, not chicken.

lHInmI8_mLKuZMoBifOWmw.text: I visited this sushi restaurant with a friend for lunch. I got the sashimi combo which came with a side salad and miso soup. The sashimi was tuna, yellowtail, some white fish and salmon. The side salad was actually quite disgusting. I had one bite and was done. My sashimi was overall okay. The white fish had an unusual texture that threw me off. I eat sushi quite often & will pretty much try anything but this was just not good. The prices are very reasonable. I would probably not return.

wtUb6LcL-iJEpZu4YDTAUg.text: Went for the lunch specials with a friend. This restaurant has been consistently good   I had the sashimi plate that came with 9 pieces of fish, miso soup and a salad. My friend ordered 2 specialty rolls that also came with soup and a salad. Oh and slices oranges at the end. Perfect meal

KpqMfEKADVgzYcnCvsnQbg.text: So here is my review. We love Sushi Mon on Maryland and Silverado and we've also had plenty of good dinners here at the Sahara location but the last few times my husband has gotten sick while still at the restaurant. And today out of all days we both are home  with food poisoning. We don't have to be a doctor to know that going to the bathroom over n over n over again .. we started to feel our stomach turn while eating so we didn't finish and instead got up to pay and to let them know we didn't finish so that they could charge us for whatever we wastes but before we could say anything the lady who i'm pretty sure is the manager came to us very rudely and in front of everyone saying "this is a NO NO in all you can eat" which we know and is why we went to the front to let them know. We have spent tons of money here and bring all our family from out of town to both locations and we will not be returning to this location again.

rfUxkY9NAR2l9ezymMnhuQ.text: Went in to try this place again tonight after about 5 years and the sewer smell was the same as the reason we stopped going here. They told us it's only been like that a week and they don't know where it's coming from. I told them it was from the sewer system pipes and we left.

bRNA1iv1UAvDoW7Uz4Ibmg.text: Really good place with good services.  I like this place, I don't think it has the freshest fish but it wasn't the worst fish I've ever had. Lol  My friends and I went there for Lunch AYCE, it was like $24 including tax.  We had half orders on a lot of the rolls because that way we can try a little bit of everything.  I do have to warn you on the 911, we are not kidding. I eat a lot of spicy food but I could barely handle the 911. They straight up use ghost peppers for it because I know what ghost peppers taste like.  LOVE their nigiri because they don't give you too much rice like other places which is super great. I love it.  Would definitely come back to this place.  And I definitely recommend everyone to go there and try the food themselves because it's not bad at all.

vt1ISrQiLU96kyUJIIqW_w.text: Since last been there 3 years ago, the management has changed and the food was no longer as good. The establishment had been expanded and added a sushi island and the all your can eat price is cut in half. However, if the food quality and selection went down by half, I don't know why I would take that extra time to go away from the Strip just to visit this place.  This had been my all time favorite in the past and this time, it let me down big time. I will no longer be visiting this restaurant. I miss the meal I had in 2011.

FVyg4NX1bu_jRtPIr8Y8NA.text: Deeeelicious sushiiiii!!! Of course get the all you can eat and order half rolls of everything...the sushi chefs will make you amaziiing rolls. Super friendly staff. Fast service. I'll have to go back so i can recommend the ones i loved :)

MiSKF6GdPNhtneApp6o03w.text: I'd give it a zero if I could. My daughter and her 3 friends went there today and all but one had the all you can eat buffet for $23 each. She called me to pick her up because she really felt sick after eating. She had big stomach aches. When we came home she said that the other 2 girls had to throw up and had stomach aches as well. We called the restaurant and the manager said to go to the doctor and have the doctor prove that it was their food which made her sick. Really? And how do I do that? Besides waffles this morning she had nothing else to eat, and the fact that her other friends got sick also should speak for itself. I just found out that one of the others called as well and the manager said she wasn't sorry that they got sick! How absolutely pathetic. We didn't want a free meal, we more wanted the money back, but the manager flat out said no money back. Don't ever go there please and eat the buffet.

Zh_76Wab2bHVOSVUd8GcoA.text: Great spot on the westside for AYCE or take-out.    All the nigiri is great.  The difference between some lower quality places in town vs the better places is always the quality of the fish.

0nDavEVsZllmHFIPBuG84A.text: I used to go here all the time, started to get a little worse each time. Last I went I asked for a side of spicy mayo with my 3 rolls, they wanted to charge me $1 extra. I understand charging extra for things... but not when I'm purchasing $30 worth of sushi. Also, every time I go in, it doesn't have the most pleasant smell either. Maybe have a plumbing issue? Anyway, they do have a great lunch special and the sushi isn't terrible. I do will go back when I'm in the area, but probably wouldn't go out of my way for it.

5EHkhcfhxelLe3otnHtNZA.text: What's important for me when I go eat AYCE sushi is not so much about sushi but I focus more on the side dishes because the biggest difference that I notice between a good place and a bad place is the non sushi items. This place in particular had an excellent salad, soft shell crab, takoyaki, garlic edamame and curry rice was extremely good. I would strongly recommend this place since it's already hard to find a japanese restaurant anywhere that has a Japanese sushi chef and server. Not to mention, the service was good too.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sashimi salad
Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Katsu curry

b9H73rLefIc81aHUWu_Aig.text: Sushi Mon has been my go-to place for probably 14 years. But I don't think I can ever go back again in good conscience. This is due to 3 issues in the past year that make it too hard for me to want to spend my money there.   A year ago, December 2017 I attempted to redeem a stamp card that had, admittedly, expired a week before. I get it, it was expired... But really?   No problem, I didn't run to Yelp and post a bad review. Instead, I kept coming here.   Second, sometime earlier this year, I went in late one night. It was still over 30 minutes before last seating as posted on the door and I was absolutely turned away!  I was so upset, but just chalked that up to being so starved that night.   Thirdly, on December 15th I went in to eat by myself. I told the hostess lady "1 for the bar".  She wrote down my name on the log. I was confused because there was at least 3 open seats at the bar. I asked her why the wait and she said there were people ahead of me. I was standing by the hostess counter and looked at the log. There was no one waiting for a seat at the bar. There was a party of 8 ahead of me on the log. That was it.  The hostess lady seemed very confused. Turns out, from the conversations I overheard, there were 2 large groups! The hostess was confused, only wrote down one, and gave the big table away to the group she did not write down!    Anyway, a server there (I'm so sorry, I forget your name) noticed me standing there and said something to the hostess about why I have not been seated. The hostess stated again about people before me.   At this point I engaged the hostess.  I said there is no one before me waiting for the bar. She kept talking about the large group... I said they are a large group they are waiting for a table. I want a seat at the bar and counted out 5 open seats at the bar. But that was all lost on the hostess. I just smiled, said thank you and walked out.  She just didn't get it. Had I stayed, I would have had to wait for an open seat at the bar until she seated the other big group at a table just because "they were there before me".   I like Sushi Mon. I like the staff mostly, the servers have always been good, and I like the sushi. But this was the last straw for me. And I just realized, all three of these incidents happened at night.   There are sushi restaurants at every intersection. I'll just have to find a new one.

Ufp07p_EapUKCF-N6ZI5jA.text: This olace is ok. The sushi is decent.  The athmosphere is regular...  They offer all you can eat and lunch special. The price is decent. They dont offer anything unique.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sushi for lunch.

_IwLHCvsgF_fjYMLMLql-g.text: I refuse to eat sushi and meat combos anywhere ese!  Can't get enough of this place! Love it!!! Food and customer service it's the best!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All gone

XNKYJ9lT9Q3RhaQbqUkrow.text: Back again with amazing service and even better food. The citrus tuna on special is incredible. 10/10 highly recommend.

o4N9duTjeenJGLw8JrPkYQ.text: Oldie but a goodie.  I remember coming here like 20 years ago when I lived around there.  Service has improved since, and so has their menu option.  Although I believe screaming orgasm used to be part of the menu, but almost no one in Vegas does it anymore...  Two things on the menu you got to try if you come: crab meat nigiri and Golden Knights roll.

q6pCs6XGxzoFMICO5X-VNQ.text: Although, I wrote a raving review last time, I was really uncomfortable with my first evening experience at this place. I felt very rushed throughout the service and felt like an intrusion the whole time, even though we were done even still two hours before the restaurant officially closes. Not sure if I'll go back, I guess I'll just have to make the trek across town to go to the Silverado location.

IQndZKC8nN_vuUgSfjhiEg.text: This used to be on my list of sushi places to come to. The AYCE for lunch is $21 and has a time limit of 45 minutes. I've come here several times and the 45 minute rule has never been enforced. But I would understand if the place was busy and the rules were enforced.   On a Sunday, we had a party of 5 with a baby and arrived at about 12pm. There were only 1 other party there and someone sitting at the bar. When we were seated, our server told us to wait to start our orders because our last person had not arrived and they would start the 45 minutes when we ordered (fair enough to ask us to wait, but then he kept insisting to enforce the 45 minute rule on us, when there was practically no one else in the restaurant).   When we started ordering, he could not keep up with us and we were waiting for our orders to come out. Our waters were never refilled until we asked. And somewhere in the middle of our meal, the uncensored version of "F*@k It" by Eamon started to play. And I asked the server to please change the music because it's disturbing to eat to it and it's making us very uncomfortable. He came back and said that it was Pandora and it could not be changed so we had to wait another 2-3 minutes for the song to end....sounds like a very family friendly place!   The restaurant got busy towards 1pm when our "time was 5 minutes over" and our last order took forever to get out to us. I almost went to the kitchen to scoop our mochi ice cream orders myself.   Overall, I thought it was sad service that makes me reluctant to go back again. I'm sure I'll find another AYCE sushi place again soon.

0PerXFhHi1QK8jRZmh2r9A.text: Each time we go to Las Vegas we always go to Sushi Mon. The manager Ellen is very friendly and she always recognizes us and greets us with a big smile. It's great food at a great value!

RWfu1vpKXQ7vVZdz5OC51w.text: First I want to say that my family and I have been going here for years. So I definitely noticed the difference when there's a new owner of the restaurant, one of them is that the sushi chefs that were regularly there are no longer there. The other is that they put some limitations on a few items, and took out a few others, which is understandable since the new owners want to try something different and make up for the money they need to get back.  I've been here a few times before making this review since I wanted to wait and see how their service and food were compared to before... and I have to say, it's about the same. The staff were friendly, and do their best to give you the service you deserve. This particular rating is for my recent visit to the establishment. Our chef for this day was Eric. He was kind, personable, and efficient. He took his time when it came to creating our sushi and asked where we were from. Being seated at the bar, I feel that there's definitely some kind of small interaction needed between clients and chef... and he did a great job doing so. He didn't push for conversation but remained interested in us. Our servers were very down-to-earth and didn't rush us at all even though it was the lunch time rush-hour.   I still wish they had the chocolate mousse and green tea creme brulee because that was something I looked forward to every time I came here. But I understand the need to cut down cost for a small business.

zwFwFxg1JQ4oCc9RTMJ9Jg.text: This was my first time at this Sushi Mon location.   I usually frequent the one on Maryland.   I appreciate that this one is larger and had more spacious seating. Obviously, it's the same menu but the quality seemed a little lower and I really like having more of sushi specials.   Overall, I would definitely say I would try it again.

bK8sVXyo1_QDUVlg5OkTXQ.text: My husband and I have had dinner here a few times.  We love the food and atmosphere, so we decided to go again on our 1st year wedding anniversary, last night.  We were seated at a table, since the sushi bar was full.  Once we were waited on, I noticed the waiter was sort of rushed to take our order.  After our first round, of the "All you can eat" deal, the waiter quickly came around and asked if we wanted dessert.  He kept rushing us by asking the same question each time he came back to our table.  Then shortly after he placed the bill on our table. And again, kept coming back to the table to check if we had paid the bill.  This all within 30min of being seated.  We understood there is a time limit, but found it quite rude to have the waiter continuously lifting up the bill to check if we had paid it.  After about 4x of this, I explained to the waiter we would pay at the register, he insisted on having us pay at the table bc they need to clear the table for the next guests.  Meanwhile my husband, still chewing his food, I asked the waiter if my husband could at least finish eating. The waiter then turned and walked away. We received a dismissive apology when we told the cashier we were rushed out of our table.  At least my husband finished his last bite, walking out the door I guess.  Worst. Service. Ever.

_BXQoeyMuz6baY6HU7uwEA.text: Sushi Mon is the sister restaurant to Goyemon, which is one of my favorites, so Sushi Mon is definitely a 5-star in my books as well!  Sushi Mon is on the West side of town, and my family and I love this place. We used to go about once a month to this location when we weren't going to Goyemon across town. We would go for either lunch ($21.95/person) or dinner ($26.95/dinner). Since the menus are essentially the same between the two, I want to call out a lot of the same reasons why we love Sushi Mon.   Firstly, there are some advantages to going for dinner - 1) they serve salmon belly nigiri, which is way better than getting regular salmon nigiri and 2) you can get 1 order of uni (sea urchin) and 1 order of amaebi (sweet shrimp). Other than these two things, you can pretty much order everything else, including the AYCE dessert, during lunch. The major differences between Sushi Mon and Goyemon is that Goyemon has grilled fish items for dinner, as well as ramen after 11pm, so if you want those items, check out Goyemon instead.  Anyway, our typical order when we go for dinner at Sushi Mon includes the following items:  1) nigiri - salmon belly, hamachi (yellowtail), saba (mackerel), super white tuna, uni (sea urchin), amaebi (sweet shrimp), snow crab meat, unagi (fresh water eel), and ikura (salmon roe) 2) rolls - Sexy Girl, Hurricane, Sushi Mon Style Lasagna 3) side dishes - steamed gyoza, yakitori, shrimp and vegetable tempura, sashimi salad, miso soup, baked green mussels, udon 4) dessert - lychee sorbet, green ice cream, strawberry mochi, green tea creme brulee  Just like Goyemon - this is one of the easiest 5-star ratings I can give on Yelp. The only complaint I have about Sushi Mon is that the wait can be long as well, although we've noticed that the wait isn't as long as Goyemon. The restaurant is not all that big, and if you have a group bigger than 4, it can take about an hour to get seated.   If you ever go to Las Vegas (and you are still reading this review), promise me you'll go to Sushi Mon or its sister restaurant, Goyemon. Ok? Cool, thanks!

osbYQ8BHzP5HTBEN6n7j_Q.text: I've been going to the Maryland location for years, but I honestly believe that this is the better location. It is smaller, but Sushi Mon's AYCE never disappoints with its offerings! My favorites are the Lemon and Yebisu, but Sunrise is great as well. Such delicious, fresh seaweed salad! The staff was friendly and the on-floor manager was really great and attentive. They were even very patient with us when we (accidentally) ended up staying past closing. Only downside (and reason for 4/5 stars) was that my party had a deep fried roll (Sexy Girl perhaps?) that still had a piece of Saran Wrap stuck to it when it was brought to the table. The staff apologized profusely and did offer to remake the roll. This seems to be a common issue, but they appear to be making steps to rectify it. Otherwise, will definitely return!

When I called, the first thing I asked was for their address and the woman on the phone didn't know. She didn't even know cross streets, so maybe she was new. But I ordered a couple rolls to pick up and they were delicious. The rice tasted very fresh and I was very pleased. It's very close to my home so I'll most likely make this my go-to spot.

5yHPYr_9r9MlwQNfuILvFQ.text: Definitely my favorite All You Can Eat sushi spot in the area! For lunch, the price is $21.95 and dinner is $26.95. Definitely worth it! The quality of fish is good for all you can eat, the nigiri is nice with little rice so you can eat more .  The wait can be busy between 6-8pm. Service is quick and on point! Definitely recommend coming by if you're looking for a solid sushi spot and not spend too much money. Enjoy!

V4buArWHCXOxDcZ7PsMjbw.text: The food is terrible. No sesame on sesame chicken! Sushi is horrible, fish is not cut properly, way too much rice! Terrible experience! We think the food is bad when we are starving that is how bad it was!

07Eqpj9ZkXa1-lU_FHz2nw.text: This server name Ulysses.. has always been the one assisting me and my family. Even when he's not, he ALWAYS provide such excellent service. Sushi Mon at this location has always been our go to sushi place. We love Sushi Mon. We were never disappointed with the food or service. But Ulysses is so wonderful and patient. Whoever the owner is must give him a raise or promote him!!!!   Update: May 12, 2019   This WAS always my families Togo sushi restaurant. The environment however is so disgusting that I had to walk out of the restaurant. It is so disappointing. We went here not too long ago and we left because there wasn't unagi. So we thought we'd give it a try again today, for Mother's Day. We waited for at least half an hour. Some customers before us left too. When we got in we didn't get our waters immediately which was fine, since it was busy. We understand. Whoever the server was that was assisting us was absolutely rude. My mother immediately felt like she wouldn't get good service and that means a lot to us since it's Mother's Day. As soon as I sat down (coming back from the restroom), even giving her my drink order was so difficult.. I immediately got up and walked out with my family. Absolutely disappointing. Honestly, this used to be a good restaurant, good fresh food, good servers .. but not. Not anymore.. I will never return to this restaurant again.. No unagi, because they only serve it on "weekdays".. bad energy.. and rude servers. I was happy to leave that place.   My family and I ended up going to Sushi Zone on spring mountain. Much MUCH better services and they had what we wanted. AND my family left happy!

LjfwF3xKchnuA3868RBoLA.text: Arrived just before lunch was over on a weekday so there were few others in the restaurant. Sergio was our waiter, and he was attentive and fast with our orders. I order in small batches because I titrate my degree of fullness and don't want to leave food on the table. Perhaps because I don't overeat and the restaurant wasn't busy, I have never been told my 45 minutes were up.   Compared to other AYCEs I think the quality of the sushi is better than most but the appetizer selection is a bit limited compared to Oyshi. The hamachi is my my benchmark and it is a beautiful cut of soft fish. There are no beef appetizers at all. Salad and miso soup is good and I liked the tempura and gyoza and shumai. Rolls are good and like that they do half rolls, when you want to try something new. Dessert is excellent as they have the best green tea ice cream.  All in all this is a great AYCE. Not as fancy as Oyshi but pleasant atmosphere and good pop-hiphop music tracks. For dinner I probably prefer the elegance and beef/pork sizzling hot plates at Oyshi but this is my preferred lunch establishment.

t8m095B1lnSjHJ_eD5m5Nw.text: I came during lunch hours and it wasn't busy at all which for an ayce spot, I think I got lucky that day. They have great customer service for a start, the guy was making sure I was good every 10 minutes. I sat at the sushi bar and the sushi chef was great when it came to personal favorites of his. I did the all you can eat and there are many choices as far as rolls and nigiri. I do recommend the lemon sushi and fried tempura ice cream. Definitely going to be my ayce spot.

nXkI_59oGoyAvgInuYwb-g.text: Whitetuna and pastel roll is my fave. Tasty and fresh. Can't go wrong with the spider roll. Wish it had the green tea creme brulee lol.

KLlsPZ6YsNc7kA7HSA4aUw.text: One of my new favorite sushi places in Vegas!! The food was amazing and the staff was very friendly! I opt for the all you can eat and what a great lunch price! Only $$21 before 4pm! I will be returning for sure!

EvUi7DqbWr-r3bnX7vJQOw.text: I haven't been there in quite a while. My friend's and I were pleasantly surprised that the service, quality of the food and price were good. We had a great time.

MM56pwXe-htmI1JaX1sEoA.text: Was here last night. One of, if not my favorite sushi place in town. Friendly staff who helps you if you don't what what fish is what. With a great selection of rolls, including the Spider and the Dragon. The sake wasn't my favorite, but overall a great place.

sIz8Xrji0l8_oyO9ANP6jQ.text: Very trendy.  They cater to a younger crowd.  The service and the atmosphere is young and now!   I got the impression that middle aged singles are not welcome. The food is good. I had the tempura it was delicious.

751vKmB7A9qTTs_usHmj-A.text: Ulysses the waitress gave us a vip attention, was kind, did our dinner a beautiful  experience,  thanks Ulysses

drssjixjuUQDoCdfXDmFJQ.text: Fresh fish, lots of options. They used to have very slow service but I find they have corrected that issue the last few times I have gone. Definitely a go to for ayce sushi. Try the orgasm salad, spicy albacore Nigiri, and the crunchy rice w spicy Tuna.

nXHsu20JENjcOJSUEYg3Cg.text: Amazing AYCE sushi!!! Great flavor and great service. The sewer smell is very off putting, but after awhile you don't notice it. The sushi makes up for the weird smell.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mid point of AYCE

DwGoXWZEMFWc8YqBpFgrrw.text: Summary: Disappointed  Cons:  -Probably the worst fish to rice ratio at an ayce sushi place I have been too. I have been to almost all of the ayce sushi place in orange county and only a handful of ayce sushi places in LA, but I have never seen a worse rice to rise ratio for both the nigri pieces and the rolls. Actually some of the rolls were ridiculous large, especially the 5 piece rolls. The biggest rolls I have ever seen. When the menu states that you will be charge for extra rice, and then the rolls comes out a gigantic and filled with rice. Should have taken a picture of this.   -Service. Our server was new, but overall very nice and did the best he can. We asked him if we can get a spider hand roll and he wasn't sure. My biggest gripe is that we have a kid. Most AYCE places have a different price for kids. He failed to mention this. A kid that is 8 years old should not be charge the same price as an adult, if everybody is charged the same price the restaurant should let customers know.   -From the rice to fish ratio, to not disclosing the price difference, can't help but feel a bit of disingenuous on part of the owner. At the very least it is a lack of disclosing information that could easily enhanced a customer's experience.   Pros: The freshness and quality of the fish is above average in comparison to most of the ayce places I have been to. Too bad you only get to get a thin slice/small piece of it. If it wasn't for the quality of the fish, this place would really get one star.

tLBkByOuoONsOLKOlVcuwA.text: I wrote a review a while back hailing how they had great lunch specials here. Alas, they switched sushi chefs again and the hand rolls have gone from hefty to mini. Sad.

9C1O9hbuxuy7IEjT_Q-bcA.text: Friendly staff. Fast service. Clean and welcoming atmosphere. Delicious food. When my friend and I sat down to eat the guy making the sushi was very accommodating and helpful. He suggested very satisfying items on the menu and kept very interactive making it a very enjoyable visit!

NVMRLt10UZzWn75iqCuI7w.text: Love love love love this place! I used to eat here a couple times a week until I was kinda spent on it. Needed a break. =)  Their waitstaff are super friendly and bust their asses to keep you happy. They always remember me when I walk in too, which makes a huge difference to me. Restaurant is always clean as well, including the bathrooms.  Everything here is delicious. I've never had one thing here that wasn't, and I've tried pretty much everything on the menu. However, they changed their menu pretty recently and got rid of a lot of the dinner specials. This makes me sad. Their "love boat" dinner special was the best! They still have a lot of dinner specials though, like the salmon special, which is so good and such a great value.  I don't think they have their volcano #2 roll either, which was amazing!  I've never done the all you can eat sushi here, so I can't vouch for that.

71HnsH0MEBM4yeY5cF--Gw.text: sushi Mon is our go to Sushi place. Food is consistent, always fresh and yummy. chef's are passionate with what they create- sushi rolls are eye catching and dekectable. the bus boy Ulysees is forever sweet, friendly and customer service is exemplary. the waitress are all pleasant and friendly. location is accessible with ample parking. cleanliness is consistent! this is one place to add to your favorites!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States

C3iVcj1LaHT3g2mDvAPcAw.text: I'm not a fan of all you can eat Asian food, because I know the quality isn't there.  I'd much prefer quality over quantity when talking about food.  I must say though sushi mon is legit.  They make all the sushi fresh to order.  You just tell the waitress or sushi chef what you want and they make it right there.  The variety of different sashimi / sushi rolls / appetizers makes this place well worth the $26.95 for dinner.    There are some sashimi's that you can only order just one per person because of how expensive it is, but at least you get to try it still.    The people working there were really nice.  It wasn't too busy, but I herd when it gets busy that the food takes awhile to come out.  You have to make sure that you eat all your food along with the rice or else you'll get charged extra.    I'll definitely come back to this place when I come back to Vegas!

4XagaGH_20ElnfthTeTk8A.text: Sushi Mon for me is hit or miss. There have been times when I've had excellent sushi and other times not so good. Staff is very friendly and welcoming which is why I keep going.

xmgzURx5Rxy5mUZVkRKuRA.text: Oy. I don't even know where to start. My friends have gone to the Sushi Mon over on Maryland before, and one of them got pretty ill, but she gets sick pretty easily so I didn't necessarily think it was cause to boycott all Sushi Mon locations in the state. How wrong I was.   I was here the other night on a date (his choice), and I was immediately underwhelmed by the super small interior, fishy smell, and the fact that they said the wait was 20 min but ended up being 35. We finally got seated at the bar and opted for the AYCE, which I normally never do, but seemed like a good idea so I could order some uni and salmon belly. I was slightly skeptical about the quality of the fish, but I've eaten a lot of gross things in my day and figured it couldn't be thaaat bad.   Well, a few pieces of sushi into the meal, a beetle comes crawling across my plate. That's right, a BEETLE. I sprang into action and crushed that sucker with my napkin, as it became incredibly clear that my date was paralyzed by bugs. Too stunned and disgusted to fully comprehend what just happened, I was in the process of looking around for a server to tell them what I saw when ANOTHER BEETLE came crawling up from under the sushi bar and onto my plate. At this point I jumped up from my seat and my date's face was white, (I was grossed out but also found this whole scenario incredibly funny, and I felt really bad for him), and as small as the place was, no other diners really seemed aware that they were eating next to bugs, and what's more alarming is that the employees barely cared!! A busser came over to take my napkins with the bugs in them that I had already killed, mumbled out an apology, and went on his way. We had to then ask for the bill so we could get out of there, but that was it, no other apology, no comping of anything, we barely ate more than 4 pieces of nigiri and they still charged us for 2 AYCE meals. Absurd.   Bugs on Sahara, recorded illnesses on Maryland, horrible service at both. Health Inspector...where are you!?

GhiIhQLnoCyippp3LjtzsQ.text: Worst sushi place I have ever been to! Don't get me wrong, the food was good..but that's nothing if the service is terrible. The guy waiter that sat us down didn't even come back to check up on us. He didn't even take our order!! We had to order from the sushi bar. But even the guys at the sushi bar weren't very helpful. We had to get their attention to get something else..and they were standing RIGHT in front of us. It seemed like they were only paying attention to the tables with more than 2 people. Def not going back.

ASBEmiIMdhZmtRzTcFYdAg.text: This is our go-to sushi place! We've tried many, and although most are good, this one just has everything we could possibly want. Huge selection, every possible combination, and they all work out awesome. My favorites are the stacey, the pastel and the j.j. Do leave some room for dessert (yep, you read me!). The lychee sorbet is incredible, the green tea creme brulee is to die for, don't get me started on the mochi ice cream, and chocolate mousse and ... I'll stop typing right now and head there! It is a terrific place!

zOHJWzTPRsrtlZk51FFOdQ.text: We came with a party of 8 and they let split with some who did AYCE and others order from the lunch menu. I ordered from the lunch menu - sushi lunch which came with some nigiri and a few pieces of cali roll. It was just ok, not great.   I watched my friends eat the AYCE and it didn't look good. They also said it wasn't the freshest and the slices of fish were small.  There are many other AYCE options in Vegas for consideration.

qdD2G0fePHMBFjous8tiSA.text: Pretty good all you can eat Mexican sushi.   They restrict the good stuff, but overall a decent meal.

TOXcsRa2vLqyib7Su3ls-A.text: The lunch and dinner selections are excellent, the grilled hamachi Kama was well done with great flavor. Service was prompt and courteous. Have referred friends to this restaurant when traveling to Las Vegas. Will try the all you can eat next visit.

Few1NSa9PiUEZPbhB8fmMg.text: Been going there for over 9 years. New owners are the worst. Unfriendly, cold, the place is dirty, they are rude and just such a bad experience. I would recommend this sushi place to anyone who is looking to stuff themselves on great food.

czxy6PgAiOXIJR8-jk5orQ.text: Worst service I have EVER experienced at  sushi restaurant.  Got in and it was half full.  We ordered and got some dishes and then everything just stopped.  All the baked items came out so you know that the sushi items were backed up.  Still waited and no one said anything to us.  We had to ask multiple times for them to check on our order and finally they asked us what items we were waiting for.  Once we told them,  the waitress left and then came back 5 minutes later asking us again what we had left! We are now leaving hungry and angry to a place we will never come back to again.  We will be sure to tell everyone to not come here again if they're craving sushi.

CEP2nSytkWXhl7uFtfjBlw.text: The sashimi lunch special is the best in town... They do not scrimp and serve large quality cuts of fresh fish... Check it out and you won't be sorry!

NjTpsB9pzHGMVMfZqv6qHQ.text: good food, but service was slow. in general not bad place but if venue is slow, then service should up to par.

ZRStJNE0YdBFs0Cp5ksuhA.text: Great selection, great pricing on the All You Can Eat.  Would go here 5x a week if it wouldn't make me 800 lbs.

xfbXYJTf-LaptH4o8lBbQQ.text: This used to be one of my favorite sushi restaurants, and I would eat there once a week, but not anymore. The old owners took a lot of pride in treating the customers well and serving high quality sushi. since it was sold, the decor might be improved but the customer service and food quality stinks! They scrimp on the servings and the service. Also,I went there on a Tuesday night, after the main dinner crowd had left.  Only 2 tables were filled with customers and they refused to seat me at any table but a tiny one facing into a corner.  I am glad there are a lot of Sushi Restaurant choices on the west side, I've taken my business elsewhere.

FnLtfNO7MNmRWojRRCzYFQ.text: Me and my family eat here very often. I can say that we've filled out those AYCE cards several times over. I always get the seaweed salad as a starter because of how fresh it tastes, and then basically any bit of sushi, nigiri, and side that they offer on the AYCE menu. I then finish off with one of their desserts such as the mochi ice cream, green tea ice cream, or litchi ice cream. Sometimes they are out of the strawberry mochi (which is my favorite) but I'm fine with getting their other flavors when that happens. While this place is kind of small, it is around the corner from my house so it is the one we always go to. I don't feel like the wait time for food is that bad; if you order several sushi dishes at once they bring the next out just as you finish off the last dish. Go as a group and all get the AYCE so you can share. Lastly, if you order an nigiri, don't forget to request their fresh wasabi to go with it!

Yw8Al2q9nI6EnTnwtEBnWg.text: UPDATE:Returned a few days ago and they definitely made some changes. The sake is very affordable not like other sushi restaurants. Also the food quality is way better. This might be my favorite place. Also the cooks are really nice and constantly check on you. Great food and service. :)

vuZ1BfEpW91YL0yUAFu4CA.text: My family of 4 live nearby and have tried this place about 4 times. Although the food is good (thanks to the sushi chefs) and reasonable, the service or lack thereof is poor to say it politely. They are simply unfriendly and border on rude at times and they act like they do not care whatsoever whether you come back or not. They do not show any appreciation for our patronage either, which is irritating to say the least when you spend your hard earned money. So much so it makes the whole experience unenjoyable.  It's too bad because we enjoy the food and love sushi and since we live nearby, we want one of those places that we can go to often and you know them and they know and its always a pleasant meal and experience. However, after eating here 4 times and hoping the service will be better each time, it just isn't and we walk out saying well at least the food was good. We really want this to be our place but I guess we'll have to give our hard earned money to another establishment that appreciates it. Very disappointing. If I could give 0 stars I would. Again, this review is not a reflection on the sushi chefs at all, the food is good, its the service and management that has driven us not to return.

q25TI5CFUrhzEDib4uKebw.text: The place smells when you walk in. Sushi was mediocre to average. Some of the more specialty nigiri (garlic tuna, seared salmon) is also topped with a ponzu sauce that makes everything fall apart and way too salty. Spider roll was also very salty. Shrimp tempura was good. Service was not bad when I was there. For a good off the strip AYCE sushi option I suggest JJANGA, which has better sushi and is a dollar cheaper.

C-BZapPShNWNn_fDv_b7nQ.text: This is perhaps the worst service I've experienced from any sushi restaurant. I was out to dinner with 2 friends & after reading the reviews this place relieved, it sounded fantastic. After the first round of orders the quality of the service & sushi went down drastically. The server let us sit for 15min after taking our plates from the first order before returning to take our follow up orders. When the 2nd order had been placed, our server returned 10min later & rudely questioned if we could even finish our order. This led to another 10min wait before receiving our food. I understand having to serve & accommodate other orders/customers, but the delivery of our food was a slow & drawn out process, especially when compared to the super quick food drops when we first sat down. Sushi that was supposed to be hot was cold, & the cold sushi was warm as if it had been sitting out. At this point we knew we were no longer wanted. After flagging down our server, we requested dessert along with the bill. The mochi was on point, but the tempura ice cream was presented in a soggy condition, ending our evening at this establishment. All of this & they had the nerve to ask for a 12% percent gratuity on the check. They treated us horribly as customers. We were not loud in anyway,  rude or disrespectful in any manner, or deserving of this horrendous customer service. I would not recommend this establishment to anyone. Don't waste your time or money.

8w3Ln006YKZABoH6a-Am-w.text: awesome all you can eat sushi spot, staff very friendly and fun, only thing I didn't like was the space, kinda small, but the food makes up for it, which is really why youre here

DndsD9sZu4xkYErdpnjFFg.text: This is about the 8th or 9th time I have eaten hear over the last 3 years and I've seen this place fall quite a bit in quality and service. We ordered the all you can eat. We both ordered rolls we had before and were surprised at both how bland they tasted but also on how a couple of them have changed. Their 9-1-1 roll, a past favorite, tasted like nothing but crappy habanero hot sauce. The staff was good and friendly until we were ready to leave. We wondered why they had not come by with the check and when we asked, they told us we had a single piece of sushi left out of the 6 rolls we ate and we were told unless we ate the last bite, they would charge us.  I've seen this policy before on many places but have never seen it implemented in such an unfriendly way. Suffice to say, we will no longer be eating here. 2 of the 6 rolls were good and the rest were meh to bad.

K2b74bkK_atyxFKA0aQzsg.text: Group of us came here. First time for me and repeat for them. Good idea to order the "all you can eat" for price, speed and selection. Ordered several items off the menue for all of us and within minutes it was on the table.  Good food and presentation along with the attention from the server. All around good time here. Will come back :)

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fast orders coming to our table! So good!
Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Starting with Eel. No wait really :)

vO27pnn4fM4MCjh0NyraEw.text: I've been a patron of Sushi Mon for as long as I can remember, and with every visit, I enjoy it more and more.  The place itself is quite small, and features a sushi bar, several tables, and booths. The service here is just lovely; everyone--from the waiters to the sushi chefs--is both kind and courteous. Whenever I enter, I'm always politely greeted by nearly everyone who works there.  The All-You-Can-Eat special at Sushi Mon is probably the best I've seen in the entire Las Vegas valley. For around $25 per person, you can choose as many different types of sushi rolls as you'd like from menus with images of virtually every item available for your convenience. Every roll--cold or baked--is made and served in a timely manner. My personal favorites are the Caterpillar, Lasagna, and Pixie rolls!  The side-dishes offered at Sushi Mon are lovely, as well. They've got anything you might possibly desire, from tuna and octopus poke to cucumber and seaweed salad, miso soup, and baked mussels. One of their newest additions is the sashimi salad, which is simply to die for.  The dessert is, without saying, extraordinary. The green tea ice cream is a must, as are their various flavors of mochi. If you're looking for a quaint little place to have sushi or any other Japanese dishes, this is the place to be!

WRnt_UgasIBNiOs9IOPgTA.text: One of the best sushi places I've been to. Very friendly staff and you can tell the chefs know what they're doing cause everything tastes super fresh. Thanks to Ulysses and Zachary for the great experience and service!

DwGk7e8CVAQaSTUv1622PA.text: bombdotcom lol For real, pretty damn good AYCE sushi. tried a bunch of different rolls, all of which had amazing flavor. We went pretty late, so we were some of the only people there and service was fast.  The "rules" posted on the little menus were kind of ridiculous, though. and the sewage smell was disgusting.  That smell wasn't around the last time I was here, though, so I wonder if the plaza is having plumbing issues? Either way, fix that, cause it's overpowering and smells like straight SH*T.

Of0T0CdGRnmABIXELurTkQ.text: 1. Go to sushi-mon on maryland 2.  Go to sushi-mon on sahara 3.  Come back and comment  Big difference.  Its disappointing cuz brought mom n dad... told then that sushi-mon is top.  Surprised didn't have to wait at the sahara location now i see why.    We craved the sea urchin... parents took a bite n told us not to eat them.  Asked waiter if can perhaps ask chef to look and exchange for us.  Without notifying chef nor manager waiter told us urchins come in the same box.  We just let the poor kid slide.    At sahara, u get way too much rice.  Suggestion:  refill drinks for customers.  Waiter shouldn't  argue with customers; call manager.  Customers are more likely to come back if u treat em right.

UUaVaDzIYRO77s0cfEaVNQ.text: We're here usually once a month, never had any complaints, the service is prompt and excellent, not what you usually get with AYCE places. Food quality is always great, excellent value for money, creative rolls as well as tried and trusted standard. Always some fun specials you should be sure to check out on the boards. Parking is easy, great location, in particular if you're living on the west side.

LAoYIBjMBmVnxaLQFeqdkA.text: This place has been here as long as I've been living in the area. It is located on Sahara just east of Durango inside a shopping complex. Had no issues parking and came at 1pm just a few hours after opening.   After the disappointment at 808 tapas I've been craving some good sushi, especially an AYCE spot. In comes Sushi Mon, their AYCE is $21.95 and they give you 45 minutes to eat. 45 minutes may not seem like a lot but at the speed they make them in and how much you can order its more than enough time.   I ordered some nigiri, salmon, squid, and cajun albacore along with 007 roll, JJ roll, pastel, and alaskan roll. It was all very delicious, service was super fast and very efficient. I was completely stuffed when I walked out and more than satisfied.   Whats great about this place is if you really want to try something but don't want the 8 pieces, they let you get a half order's with 4 pieces, so you can really try a diverse selection rather than get stuffed on a few items. Remember anything you don't finish they charge you for so make sure your eyes aren't bigger than your stomach.  Get their frequent dining card, after the 10th AYCE you get one free, whats great is if your with someone and they get the AYCE it counts as two on your card so if you go with people that don't go often get credit for their meal. All in all I enjoyed my lunch, at dinner its 3 dollars more for their AYCE and they give you 15 more minutes for a total of 1 hour.

mRM-WrqY7M6JvKNL5nrgpw.text: Wonderful selection of sashimi and specialties creations as part of the all you can eat menu. Well thought out all you can eat menu with the consumers value in mind.  They offer what most places in town try and either upscale or don't even offer.  Very fast to the table even when it's busy

NpD1ASCYBi_F4NRZ8wBvog.text: I've been to almost every sushi spot in Vegas and this isn't at the top of my list. The sushi is good, nothing different than what you get anywhere else. I always get Sashimi so it's fairly standard anywhere. This review is mostly about the service. We didn't care for our server. There are usually two people who wait on you; one who takes your food order and one who does drinks and brings your stuff. The young guy we had was very nice and acknowledged us. The much older short lady was rude. Got forbid she takes your order, she rolls her eyes at you as if you are bothering that you're spending money.   I doubt we will return. This place is the sister sushi place of Goyemon and that place has MEH service, too.

WGVglXzdWCjz6zwyzgl5fA.text: After eating here for many years, our favorite sushi chef Hiro-san is gone and now a bunch of inexperienced chefs have taken over. For the first time in 25 years, I spent the night throwing up bad sushi. This used to be a very nice restaurant with the freshest Sushi. Not anymore.

8NrmrYxdScr57ccU852V2w.text: The sushi chefs are great.  The food was great but haven't returned since 2014 for one reason even though it was one of my favorite spots to go to.  I will never return just because the waitress/ female server scolded me for having leftovers.  I was extremely stuffed and couldn't take another bite.  She said that "next time, don't leave leftovers. I said, maybe there won't be a next time.  There will never be a next time.

4lGXeYqbFtgufxwidt0YlA.text: This is a great place for sushi. The specials are good- had the salmon belly and it was  delicious. I think it is a great place to relax, hangout and enjoy their fabulous cuisine. The staff is super friendly. Their ice cream is good. I recommend getting the pork cutlet combo! Also Ulysses is a great waiter.

ROskNxtGiCw0kP_44Z9lYg.text: One of the best sushi places I've been to. I have been to a few, but this one is definitely one of the favorites.  I have gone there twice in the past couple of weeks for their all you can eat sushi. Amazing service, and the sushi were just delicious!  A bit pricey, but totally worth it!

z6aCnBnxJsIdOiigcCiw_A.text: This used to be our main All-you-can-eat sushi place where we'd go twice a week. It all changed when they got new owners. It's okay, but not the same service -- probably because our regular sushi chefs went to Goyemon.   They have the same menu as before but the quality is different. I know you're thinking, how I can tell, but if you've gone to the same place for years and the fish doesn't taste the same, then I have to say the quality is different.   On the other hand, compared to many of the other sushi restaurants, I think it passes for OK. The new service is friendly.  If you're nearby and you needed AYCE sushi place, try it. It might not be the best, but probably a good value.

OjMviZcDvLJJGwR0W4f9yg.text: Great first impression! We were greeted at the door by a friendly hostess as the rest of staff greeted us also.  My husband and I each ordered the all you can eat dinner.  Great selection and variety, even the desserts! Definitely not disappointed!

9D0i6G3BMfUxTzyvHkH9_w.text: This place was a good deal! I liked the fact u can do all u can eat with appetizers. It's flavorful & pretty filling  I normally go to Oyshi, but def will come here again due to their fast service

ALhFbpnRDc2C9J5xZTiI1A.text: THE BEST QUALITY of Sushi I've ever had in U.S.! Very affordable too. Luch spacials are only $8 and all you can eat for $21. I wish they open one in California. Another reason to come back to Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. IKURA (salmon roe) is my favorite!

cnnByFcqIHYcW7sFUNPRig.text: Sushi Mon's Chef Soto is one of Las Vegas' best-kept secrets!* Go right before lunch ends, around 3PM, sit at the bar, and make a new friend.  I  have him do an omakase-style meal of nigiri and the daily specials (which are all reliably great!), and eat until I can't anymore. Soto is good at pacing so you can enjoy quite a few pieces of fish before unbuttoning your pants or admitting defeat, and is quite charming to make conversation with as you munch.  Stellar stand-outs: fresh scallop, garlic tuna, cajun albacore, tuna hand roll, ika with mint (totally crazy!), and the sea bass. Sides of mussels, miso, orgasm salad and/or sashimi salad are also good add-ons.   I'm not too big on rolls here unless I'm ordering to-go, but the Lemon roll, Crispy Spicy Roll, and Moon roll are all good picks- they have quite an extensive menu organized by specials, fried rolls, and tempura rolls and most have pictures to accompany them.  For dessert, I tend to stick to the classic green tea ice cream which is never gritty or chalky, while my BF swears by their tempura ice cream (today's special flavor was chocolate-fudge), but they also have a green tea creme brulee on the dinner menu that I've been meaning to try.  All the staff here are incredibly friendly and genuine, but Chef Soto is my favorite. Even if he's not working, all the guys are willing to feed you the best quality and best tasting fish in town, served with a smile and a joke or two.  EDIT: dropping my rating. Chef Soto and several other familiar faces behind the bar are gone, and with them the top-notch service and quality I've loved about this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half crispy rice and half sunrise
Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Handrolls

8_xhJ7pprCat12JqrgADsw.text: If I could eat sushi everyday for the rest of my life I would. Sushi Mon is a cute lil' sushi restaurant located on Sahara and Cimarron next to Nothing Bundt Cakes. I was being lazy one night and didn't want to dine in, so I got my food to go. Staff was friendly and my order came out quickly. I ordered three rolls:  Sushi Mon Lasagna Pastel  Domingo  One thing to note is that the sauces come on the side with to go orders. This is good because it gives me a chance to try the rolls naked. I loved the Domingo roll. It has tuna and avocado with jalapeno salsa on top and ponzu sauce. This roll was super tasty as is, but the addition of ponzu sauce upped the ante for me. I wouldn't hesitate to order this again.  The lasagna was a second favorite. This roll is very decadent. Cream cheese and scallops baked on top of a California roll and smothered in eel sauce. Soooo good and probably a billion calories a piece, but so worth it. I was hesitant the first time I ever tried a lasagna roll. Who knew cream cheese would be so good with fish? Not me. But it is amazing. This is a very rich roll so maybe try half if you have never had it before.   The pastel was good as well but was my least favorite. It had shrimp and crab wrapped in soy paper, and shrimp and avocado on top. I omitted the cream cheese from this roll but it does come with it. After that lasagna roll I couldn't think about eating more cream cheese. Eel sauce and spicy mayo top this, but I felt like the sauces didn't add much to a pretty plain roll.   While I sat and waited for my order I was offered water which I declined but thought was nice. Everyone I came across was nice and they even thanked me for waiting. I will be back for the AYCE- Lunch is $21.95 and dinner is $26.95.

So we made sure we Ate it's worth. Will return next time in Vegas.

sHfbrj0S1jIbjETIkBDctQ.text: ...... still my favorite sushi restaurant ever.   Amazing ayce dinner!   Fresh fish and a lot of varieties ......  so good they already saw me twice this week.

VkZZdU5vlRKq3v86KJwQkw.text: When ever I visit Vegas I try to make it a point to visit this place once before I leave. Great staff. Food comes such with the ayce. Great taste. I will constantly repeat.

KrJrWli2bza_4DHOHvPUrA.text: This place has a large variety of specialty rolls. We tried half orders of most of the ones with tuna and crab (our favorite kind). The one that stood out was the 911 roll. It was spicy! Great flavor but took us a little by surprise. Try the spider roll also.   Time limit is 60 min for AYCE but we went a little over and they didn't mind. We were busy talking so the understood. We only reordered once for more food and then of course for dessert. Service was really attentive.

9-pCMYWFjRI44H-qloiKuQ.text: Sushi mon was A-OK. We were pressed for time so we just wanted something quick, easy and that would fill us up.   We tried 3 different rolls:   Spider roll - (5pcs) Deep fried soft shell crab, crab meat, cucumber and avocado wrapped in soy paper with eel sauce $9.95- The soy paper was green so it looked interesting. The fried crab flavor was faint and almost tasted like shrimp tempura. I wouldn't say it's the best roll I've ever ate, it was basic and not memorable.  Volcano roll - (8pcs) California roll with yum yum sauce & scallop  $8.95 - it was smothered in yum yum mayo/eel sauce. I'm not complaining since I love that decadent stuff.   Caterpillar roll - (8pcs) Eel and cucumber wrapped with sliced avocado & eel sauce $9.95 - one of the classics! It was good, the eel was fatty and I enjoyed it. But $10 is pretty pricy in my opinion.   I think that they are overpriced for their presentation and what was offered to us. But businesses have to make their money somehow!

2VxNiKa7-Bc5KbulcoRSog.text: Want to feel guilty for ordering food? Glared at for asking for refills? Want staff that will leave you waiting and only take half your order and somehow all your food comes out the wrong temperatures when there's only a few tables? Then this is the place for you!  Complete with staff that won't help you with questions about the menu, will scream " EXCUSE ME" multiple times in rapid succession in your ear to take a straw wrapper off the table, and chefs who will treat you as a burden for ordering, not smile, make eye contact, and make insults about you to other chefs. All terrific highlights. I even invited company both times I've tried this place so all of us could share this experience! I'm so glad I gave this place 2 chances to "wow" us

a3Z7v4vSR7iomYCwcOZxyQ.text: I have been coming here for a ling time and I don't really write reviews but I have to say this is one of my top sushi places to go to, hands down!! I have not had any major let downs from this place from past visits. I did go to Sushi Mon last night and a few nights before and both visit were pleasant. :)  Restaurant A bit small but it is worth the wait if you go with a group. Price is a bit more than most places but worth every single penny. :) Family oriented and clean kind of. The restrooms did have a smell but what would you expect, people do their business in there. Lol   Service Is on point, my server was very friendly and suggested a few other food items that weren't listed on the menu. She also tended to my table before the food was done/finished so waiting for the next orders wouldn't take long to wait.   Food Nigiri was awesome. Came out quick and the salmon belly is mouth watering. You just have to ask since they do run out quickly. Lol The baked mussels are fresh unlike a few other places where they get precooked mussels. :( Pork belly is good but not the best that I have tried at a sushi restaurant. They also do half orders on most of their rolls, so if your not to sure if you can finish just get half order or hand rolls.  Cons They don't  serve fresh oysters and the steamed gyoza was burt at the bottom of them :(  All in all 4.5 stars :) good job Sushi Mon.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seared tuna

SMyUbe_1kxywfQRGWqrK2A.text: My fiance and I always come here when we're craving sushi. It's our go to sushi place!   The service is delightful! The waiters/waitress are very polite and quick. They filled up our glasses as needed, cleaned our dishes as often as possible. (We ordered a lot at a time for a very little table, them taking our dishes away constantly helped a lot!)   As for the food, 11/10 highly recommend! The baked mussels here are my favorite. We always do AYCE when we come here. The sushi is never dry, it's refreshing. The sushi here is never overloaded by rice like some places. It's the right amount of rice to compliment the fish.  The experience I had here was amazing. This will always be my go to spot for sushi!

Q3oEZgCyMRHzRju9GHlQkA.text: I love sushimon! In fact I even had my birthday here ! If you have your birthday there, they give you a free t shirt. And it's really convenient because a nothing bundt is right next door so that's where I got my birthday cake from. I have also been for their lunch sushi special which is only $9. It comes with California roll and sashimi sushi rolls. It also comes with miso soup and salad! I love it here and love coming back!
