qv5N5-Yi3Z6J-LcviP27nQ.text: The all you can eat special was fantastic. They made the rolls nearly as quickly as I could order them. Everyone was super friendly and they handled our large party with great aplumb.  Would definitely recommend this place for sushi.  I'm sad I don't live nearby.. I would definitely be a regular here.

LLafZPCJb-fPwMeK1FARGg.text: My in-laws wanted to get all you can eat sushi and this place had the shortest wait time.  We were skeptical at first but compared to the other all you can eat sushi places in Vegas, we really liked it here.   They give you a very small amount of rice without the overpowering seasoning of Yuzu on the sushi.  The choices for appetizers and daily specials are very abundant compared to the other places.  Fish tasted fresh and pretty good for an all you can eat restaurant.  Our server was excellent and always had a smile on his face despite the numerous times we placed our orders.  The only disappointment was their dessert.   But after stuffing yourself with so much food, there is barely any room for dessert anyways.  The more popular all you can eat spots in Vegas will have you waiting for over an hour.  I think this place is less busy but offers better food.  Definitely worth the price!  Free sake when you show Facebook check in!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_v9QLE5PIj5gxMtYx9FWxg.text: OK.  I went back to Sushi Mon on Monday, and after the service issues I had before, I was very nervous.  Let me just say that my faith has been restored.  The fish was still wonderful, as it always is, but the big improvment for me was the service.  We sat at the bar, and the place was packed.  Our chef was Tony, who was an absolute pleasure.    We had servers stopping by filling up our water glasses, asking if we wanted anything off the menu with the AYCE.  Everyone was polite and VERY quick.    No more waiting for 20 minutes for our check!    Also, they finally updated the website and took down the All you can drink ad that was up there forever.   I'm a little upset that they still have not replied to the emails I sent them about that, but...it is what it is.   I feel much better about going to this, my favorite All You Can Eat sushi restaurant since the service improved so much.

gaiC8ZkabDLJyA63zQsccg.text: We were turmed away at Sasa. Did us a favor, because it brought us back to our favorite all you can eat place!. Greeted right away, they honor what's written on door for hours of service. Drink and food order started right away. Sushi Nigiri a little small, but is the norm in all you can eat places. All seemed fresh, and all food, especially the grilled pork belly was good.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sushi Mon! Presidents day.

GVWqSAgnXUfTMyJKvmo3pQ.text: I love this place! I always get ayce because as much as I eat it's worth it. They have a good variety of appetizers that come with the ayce I always get baked mussels and garlic edamame. My favorite nigiri is garlic tuna and Cajun albacore. The Cynthia roll and spider roll are delicious!!! This is my to go spot and even when it's busy we still get great service.

Sq4Wly50nSHOXK5CV1uZCQ.text: Saturday night begins at our local favorite Sushi Mon. We had  AYCE for $26.95/person available 4:00 PM - Midnight. Remember last order must be placed by 11:30 PM. You have 60 minutes to consume your full  order.  The children shared a Tempura Special. Two asparagus spears, carrot, sweet potato slice, yam, and onion we're the veggie selections. Salad, 4 shrimp, rice, and two more salads accompanied the main entree.  I am hoping for organic rice at a Las Vegas sushi restaurant and I will continue to keep up the search.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Mon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. No Name and Athena rolls (8 pc or 4 pc available)

S5D7xOsmmukbcrn8xuDAlQ.text: We decided to come here after learning it was part of the "mon" chains and we love goyemon! It's a smaller establishment and I used to come here a bunch when it was owned by an previous owner. We were seated right away and they told me that it would be $3 bucks for my one year old to eat. That irked be a little bit, because 1. how much can a one year old really eat and 2. I was feeding my child food that I had brought at that exact moment when they asked.   Overall, the sushi quality was decent. Like other Yelpers have said the selection isn't as large as Goyemon, but the main thing was that the sushi quality was good and I actually did enjoy it. Halfway through the meal it realized one of the sushi chefs was a chef I knew from before.  Chef Tony is awesome! If I ever get a chance to sit at the bar I would want him to make my sushi.   Service was a bit slow, but the sushi came out fairly quick.  It just takes awhile to get their attention to order more when you are at a table. I will be back for some more sushi one of these days!

UgtsPZlFg1K3vnpgC8Tizw.text: This is my favorite sushi place in Vegas. The food is simple and fresh with a nice sized piece of fish on each nigiri. While some of the nigiri and rolls have sauces, they don't overpower the fish at all. So many other sushi places rely on their sauce, not quality of fish. Since they've been under new management, the quality has gone up. We typically do AYCE, but if we don't, we get a sashimi dinner...so good and reasonably priced.

h24wU3njrkfJaUpCwrYNxg.text: This is one if the better places in Vegas for AYCE. What I like most is that you can get half orders of most rolls, leaving you free to try out a variety of menu items. Cajun albacore and super white tuna are a must. Additionally, tempura ice cream is on the dessert menu included in AYCE price! Service is excellent, and sushi chefs are very friendly.

PsV_D3VBiGpavjNOc15Trg.text: The sushi is great, nice and fresh! I do wish the place was bigger because there is always at least a 30 min wait. There is a line that goes out the door sometimes. But the sushi is a good price for the quality!

kuHiVOZRy_VZC8jTELmSGg.text: This place is clean and the staff is friendly and attentive but if you have a shellfish allergy, don't expect special treatment.  They will not switch out the shrimp tempura for veggie tempura if you order 'all you can eat'.  The good news is that you can order half rolls and try a little of everything.  The 911 roll is no joke.  My bad ass husband was tearing up like a school girl and he does like it hot.  The salmon is nice and fatty and the proportion of salmon and rice is in your favor.  If you sit at the bar, there are little hooks for purses, which is nice.  There is nothing to complain about here.  The sushi is fantastic.

rl2CIHJYemR0vfOgSZoFzQ.text: We go here regularly - it is a solid 4 star sushi restaurant with good, quick service and consistently fresh food. Are there better sushi places with fancier rolls? Yes. But the service is wonderful and the prices are more than reasonable. It is our go-to place and we would recommend it any day.

PwjMAZmKXlE3YGpCP_pajg.text: For an AYCE spot it is a must. Both Sushi Mon's are one of the best as far as AYCE goes. Also they get some stuff that the other guys do not and the chefs are awesome. Sit in front of Ben if you can.

kNs0g98_skbIW8SX6J06pQ.text: A great sushi place. The fish quality is very good. I only had one bad experience at the restaurant. And it was an employee with a smart mouth. I don't think I can hold it against the place because of a low level employee. So if you are looking for sushi, try it out.

MACgW5aoBqMxiZWkvMsewQ.text: Great food!!!!! Staff is very friendly.   Fast service!!!  The buffet is worth it!!!!!

koI7D9-dIC9D-TDYdPKkmA.text: AYCE here is okay. Service is okay, but the sushi quality is okay.

V-JYD6eZhDkHsE-7YQxQRg.text: Not a fan of all you can eat places, particularly when seafood is involved. Often it is an indicator the a la carte is going to be sub par. That being said, seems many of the LV sushi places are all you can eat. Sushi Mon is close by so have tried 2x. It did the trick for a few mediocre rolls of average construction.  Tried the softshell crab tempura which had a funky been sitting in the freezer too long taste.  The service is average as well. Am unsure why this place has gotten such rave reviews. Agree with some other yelpers this place is over-hyped

1DaGzR1sZp0bbgWnFQ1hGQ.text: Excellent sushi and the all you can eat package is truly a bargain. I highly recommend this awesome restaurant. The staff is friendly and service is quick. The sushi is amazing.

qJ7-xHGEjZXuqqqkDPvqkQ.text: Went there for Mother's day,  party of 3 around 9pm. First time customers, we all did the AYCE. Sushi and side dishes came out pretty quick.  Side dishes were great,  sushi was good but I've had better. My son didn't care for the uni,  as it is one of his favorites. Just the quality and lack of taste wasn't up to par for him. He ordered one of the rolls with crunchies but it tasted stale. My husband who likes spicy sms hot couldn't handle the 911 roll. The spicy tuna was great but it was an even toss up of good and not so good rolls. No sashimi (but most ayce don't have), No raw oysters (again usually you don't see that for ayce). That's okay I have my favorite spot where I get both in the ayce.  I love sweets and the bonus is that you are not limited to one dessert only.  So I really enjoyed the lychee sorbet,  mochi ice cream and tempura ice cream. The service was good, around enough to take orders and clear plates.  They just never offer refills,  even when our cup is empty we had to ask for the refills.  I would go back,  but not a big deal if I don't make it.

ZVZVE3HKHH0hBSk8mZa6WA.text: New management, with better quality of foods! Even isn't AYCE, a la carte menu is valuable and it's delicious! Just missed Happy hour of beer and sake, on Sunday, Monday, Tuesday only, so we will try again!

clMzqE7c_ydAoQIsfZgL-A.text: So yummy! Had a dinner date with my girls and we so amazing. You definitely need to get there early they are really busy around dinner time! The conch was delish! Ayce is a must then you can try a bit of everything! They also do half rolls which makes it easier to taste everything. The strawberry saki was very good as well! Will definitely be coming here again!!

2V0dzzcuyrG0wDtruWNivA.text: Worst experience today! We always come here (almost every week to be exact). Often we get the nice lady servers or the Japanese servers who were always so nice and funny! Unfortunately today we had this server who's fairly new compared to the others named Zac---- I don't want to spell his name out. But, the last time as well around November or so, I remember he only got 40% of our orders right which had led us to stop coming here. But then we gave this place a chance and came back from January until today. We were celebrating a birthday and my aunt, who doesn't know how to use the chopsticks very well, dropped two small pieces of rice on the bare table as she was grabbing sushi from the middle of the table. So tiny that literally if I can count the grains approximately 10 grains. So this server named Zac---- came in sarcastically implying that he was gonna charge us for those, pointing at those small pieces and rolling his eyes at the same time. My aunt felt so bad that she said she was just gonna eat it but he said oh sure don't worry about it. So what was he really implying? Never coming here again and just so you have an idea how many times we go here, we've used 5 of the stamp cards already! Note: if you're coming here and you want great service, avoid the one person with the Zac---- first letters! All the other ladies are so nice! But just avoid this one server! Ugh definitely ruined our dinner. What a guy!
